Name: Albert Alderson
Title: Albert Alderson file
Description: File documenting the participation of Albert Alderson in World War I. Alderson enlisted in the Army on May 5th, 1917, and was first stationed in Fort Riley, Kansas. He served in the 338th Field Artillery (Camp Dodge, Iowa), the 352nd Infantry, and the 30th Infantry (Mayen, Germany). He was involved in the Meuse-Argonne Offensive. File includes address card, student information form, and letters.

Name: Ernest Bruce Allan
Title: Ernest Bruce Allan file
Description: File documenting the participation of Ernest Bruce Allan in World War I. Allan enlisted in the Army on August 18, 1917. He served with the 349th Infantry at Camp Dodge, Iowa, and with the 328th Infantry at Camp Gordon, Georgia, before being sent overseas. Allan was in the battles of Saint-Mihiel and Argonne Forest. He was hospitalized at Varrenes, France on October 18, 1918. File includes questionnaire, index card, several extensive letters, and newspaper clippings.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Infantry Regiment, 328th
Topics: Allan, Ernest Bruce; Illinois State Normal University--Students; World War, 1914-1918; Saint-Mihiel, Battle of, Saint-Mihiel, France, 1918; Argonne, Battle of the, France, 1918

Name: Claude F. Armstrong
Title: Claude F. Armstrong file
Description: File documenting the participation of Claude F. Armstrong in World War I. Armstrong enlisted in the Army on June 21, 1916 and served with the 5th Infantry, the 33rd Division, and the 108th Supply Train. He served at Camp Waston, Illinois, Camp Parker, Illinois, and Camp Logan, Texas, before being sent overseas. Armstrong arrived in Brest on May 30, 1919, and was a motor cycle dispatch rider for the American Expeditionary Forces at various locations including Mersch, Luxembourg. File includes address card, letter, and newspaper clipping.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Division, 33rd; United States. Army. Supply Train, 108th
Topics: Armstrong, Claude F.; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students;

Name: Stanislaus Arseneau
Title: Stanislaus Arseneau file
Description: File documenting the participation of Stanislaus Arseneau in World War I. Arseneau enlisted in July 1917, and served in the Red Cross, the U.S. Army Medical Reserve, the Army Sanitary Corps, and the Army Ambulance Services. Between 1917 and 1919 he was stationed at Chicago, Camp Crane, Pennsylvania, the Army Medical School in Washington, D.C., and the Pathological Laboratory Base Hospital in Camp Lee, Virginia. He was discharged August 15, 1919. He died in 1922 following an illness related to his war service.
Related organization/service branch: American National Red Cross; United States. Army; United States. Army. Medical Officers' Reserve Corps; United States. Army. Sanitary Corps; United States. Army. Ambulance Service
Topics: Arseneau, Stanislaus; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students
Genre/format: questionnaires; index cards; letters (correspondence); newspaper clippings; obituaries

Name: Ralph Austin
Title: Ralph Austin file
Description: File documenting the participation of Ralph Austin in World War I. Austin entered the service on April 3, 1918 and served in the 68th Artillery at Fort Terry, New York, before being sent overseas, where he served in Bordeaux and Saint-Pardon, France. He was discharged on March 6, 1919. File includes survey, photograph of Austin in uniform, RSVP card, letter, and a poem.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Coast Artillery Regiment, 68th
Topics: Austin, Ralph; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students
Genre/format: questionnaires; photographs; reply cards; letters (correspondence); poems

Name: Ellen C. Babbitt
Title: Ellen C. Babbitt file
Description: File documenting the participation of Ellen Babbitt in World War I. Babbitt entered the Red Cross in March 1918. She served in the Children's Bureau in Washington, D.C., Lyon, Marsaille, and Paris in France, and in England and Scotland, working on children's welfare education. File includes service record card, photograph of Babbitt, newspaper clipping, and two letters, including a personal letter from Babbitt to Ange Milner.
Related organization/service branch: American National Red Cross; American National Red Cross. Children's Bureau
Topics: Babbitt, Ellen C., 1872-; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students
Genre/format: index cards; photographs; letters (correspondence); newspaper clippings

Name: Harry Philip Bangert
Title: Harry Philip Bangert file
Description: File documenting the participation of Harry Philip Bangert in World War I. Bangert enlisted on August 10, 1917, and was a master electrician in the 93rd Aero Squadron at Jefferson Barracks, Missouri, San Antonio, Texas, Mineola, New York. He was sent overseas in October 1917 and stationed in England at Stamford, Lincoln, Stockbridge, Hants (now Hampshire), and Beaulieu. On July 5, 1918, he transferred to France, at Issoudun, Vaucouleurs, Lisle en Barrois, and Brest. He participated in the Battle of St. Mihiel and the Meuse-Argonne Offensive. Bangert left France on March 4, 1919, and was discharged on May 8, 1919. File includes questionnaire, index card, photograph of Bangert in uniform, letters, and RSVP card. Description supplemented by information from Fold3.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Air Service; United States. Army. Air Service. Aero Squadron, 93rd
Topics: Bangert, Harry Philip; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students; Saint-Mihiel, Battle of, Saint-Mihiel, France, 1918; Argonne, Battle of the, France, 1918
Genre/format: questionnaires; index cards; photographs; letters (correspondence); reply cards;

Name: Harry Philip Bangert
Title: Harry Philip Bangert file
Description: File documenting the participation of Harry Philip Bangert in World War I. Bangert enlisted on August 10, 1917, and was a master electrician in the 93rd Aero Squadron at Jefferson Barracks, Missouri, San Antonio, Texas, Mineola, New York. He was sent overseas in October 1917 and stationed in England at Stamford, Lincoln, Stockbridge, Hants (now Hampshire), and Beaulieu. On July 5, 1918, he transferred to France, at Issoudun, Vaucouleurs, Lisle en Barrois, and Brest. He participated in the Battle of St. Mihiel and the Meuse-Argonne Offensive. Bangert left France on March 4, 1919, and was discharged on May 8, 1919. File includes questionnaire, index card, photograph of Bangert in uniform, letters, and RSVP card. Description supplemented by information from Fold3.

Name: Roy Alexander Black
Title: Roy Alexander Black file
Description: File documenting the participation of Roy Alexander Black as a private in the Army in World War I. He enlisted April 2, 1918 and served in the 21st and 168th Coast Artillery and the 138th Field Artillery. After being stationed at Fort Terry and Fort Totten, New York, and Camp Merrith, New Jersey, he was sent overseas on October 15, 1918, initially arriving in Liverpool, England and eventually moving on to Camp de Meucon, France. He was discharged January 11, 1919. File includes a survey and address card.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Coast Artillery Regiment, 21st ; United States. Army. Coast Artillery Regiment, 168th; United States. Army. Field Artillery Regiment, 138th

Name: Bane Bryan Blankenship
Title: Bane Bryan Blankenship file
Description: File documenting the participation of Bane Bryan Blankenship in World War I. He enlisted on December 13, 1917. He received training at Camp Sevier, South Carolina, with the 646th Aero Squadron and was sent overseas on April 30, 1918. He participated in the Battle of Chateau Thierry. He was hospitalized at three different towns in France, including Bordeaux, and later at Fort Snelling, Minnesota, and Camp Grant, Illinois. He was discharged on February 1, 1919. File includes a survey, an address card, a photo, and an RSVP card. Description supplemented by information from Fold3.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Air Service; United States. Army. Air Service. Aero Squadron, 646th

Title: Walter Leroy Bown file
Description: File documenting the participation of Walter Leroy Bown in World War I. He was sent to France on September 30, 1918, with the 309th Mechanical Repair Shop. He was hospitalized for an operation on December 10, 1918, in Langres, France, and transferred to Base Hospital no. 99 in Hyeres, France on December 27, 1918. Bown returned to the States on February 3, 1919, and was discharged on March 5, 1919. File includes a survey, a photo, letters, and an RSVP card.

Title: Walter Leroy Bown file
Description: File documenting the participation of Walter Leroy Bown in World War I. Brown enlisted on Dec 17, 1917, and served as a mechanic in the 304th Mechanical Repair Shop at Fort Sam in Houston, Texas. He was sent to France on September 30, 1918, with the 309th Mechanical Repair Shop. He was hospitalized for an operation on December 10, 1918, in Langres, France, and transferred to Base Hospital no. 99 in Hyeres, France on December 27, 1918. Bown returned to the States on February 3, 1919, and was discharged on March 5, 1919. File includes a survey, a photo, letters, and an RSVP card.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Mechanical Repair Shop, 304th; United States. Army. Mechanical Repair Shop, 309th
Topics: Bown, Walter Leroy; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: Wakefield W. Boyer
Title: Wakefield W. Boyer file
Description: File documenting the participation of Wakefield W. Boyer in World War I. Boyer enlisted on July 7, 1919, and served in the 27th Infantry. He was stationed in Beresovka and Vladvestock in Siberia, Manila on the Philippine Islands, and Honolulu, Hawaii. He was discharged on January 20, 1921.

Name: Dwight Funk Bracken
Title: Dwight Funk Bracken file
Description: File documenting the participation of Dwight Funk Bracken in World War I. Bracken enlisted on May 23, 1918, in the Naval Reserve Flying Corps. He was first stationed at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology's ground school in Boston. He transferred to Miami, Florida, on May 23, 1918, for flight training, and on August 18, 1918, to Pensacola, Florida, for more training. He was discharged on March 8, 1919. File includes Bracken's service record card, a photo, letters, newspaper clippings, and RSVP card.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Navy; United States. Naval Aviation Corps; Massachusetts Institute of Technology
Topics: Bracken, Dwight Funk; World War, 1914-1918; University High School (Normal, Ill.)--Students

Name: Noah Omega Braden
Title: Noah Omega Braden file
Description: File documenting the participation of Noah Omega Braden in World War I. Braden enlisted in the Navy on April 5, 1918, and served as a radio electrician first at Newport, Rhode Island. He transferred to Cambridge, Massachusetts, on July 10, 1918, and then to Brooklyn Navy Yard, New York, on December 12, 1918, where he was hospitalized for influenza in March 1919. He was assigned to the U.S.S. Charlot on May 13, 1919, and sailed to Portsmouth, England, Libau (now known as Liepaja in Latvia) and Riga (now located in Latvia) in Russia, Kiel, Germany, Danzig (now known as Gdansk), Poland, Haukipudas in Finland, Stockholm, Sweden, and Cardiff and Pembroke in Wales. He returned to the States on September 20, 1919, and was discharged on October 4, 1919. File includes a survey, address cards, a photo, and newspaper clippings.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Navy; New York Naval Shipyard
Topics: Braden, Noah Omega; Influenza Epidemic, 1918-1919; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students
Genre/format: questionnaires; reply cards; cards (information artifacts); photographs; letters (correspondence); newspaper clippings;

Name: Friedolin R. A. Brandenburger
Title: Friedolin R. A. Brandenburger file
Description: File documenting the participation of Friedolin R.A. Brandenburger in World War I. He enlisted December 11, 1917, and received training at Jefferson Barracks, Missouri. He joined the 317th Field Artillery as a musician in July 1918 at Camp Jackson, South Carolina. He was sent overseas on August 7, 1918, and stationed in Flangebouche, France, until October 16, 1918, when he was transferred to Valdahon, France. After the armistice was signed, he was sent to Plaines, France, on December 1, 1918. Brandenburger was discharged on July 12, 1920. File includes a survey, address card, Brandenburger's service record card, a photo, letters, envelopes, and postcards.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Field Artillery Regiment, 317th
Topics: Brandenburger, Friedolin R. A.; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students
Genre/format: questionnaires; reply cards; cards (information artifacts); photographs; envelopes; letters (correspondence); postcards;

Name: Benjamin Herbert Briggs
Title: Benjamin Herbert Briggs file
Description: File documenting the participation of Benjamin Herbert Briggs in World War I. Briggs enlisted on September 5, 1917, and first joined the officers' training school at Camp Pike, Arkansas. He joined the 349th Infantry at Camp Dodge, Iowa, and later the 346th Infantry at Camp Pike. He transferred to Carnegie Institute of Technology in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, on July 18, 1918, as an instructor for the Student Army Training Corps. He was discharged in March 1919. File includes service record card, letter, and newspaper clippings.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Infantry Regiment, 349th; United States. Army. Infantry Regiment, 346th; Carnegie Institute of Technology; United States. Army. Students' Army Training Corps

Name: Leo Edgar Bright
Title: Leo Edgar Bright file
Description: File documenting the participation of Leo Edgar Bright in World War I. Bright enlisted on December 5, 1917, and served in the 38th Aero Squadron at Rantoul, Illinois. He transferred to Waco, Texas, on December 12, 1917, to join the 39th Aero Squadron. On July 20, 1918, he joined the radio school at Carnegie Institute of Technology in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania. He was transferred to Hempstead in Long Island, New York, in October 1918. He was discharged on December 9, 1918. File includes survey, service record card, letter, newspaper clippings, and RSVP card.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Air Service; United States. Army. Air Service. Aero Squadron, 38th; United States. Army. Air Service. Aero Squadron, 39th; Carnegie Institute of Technology

Description: File documenting the participation of Charles E. Broadhead in World War I. Broadhead entered the Army in 1917 and served in the 341st Infantry and the 130th Infantry. He went to Luxembourg as part of the Army of Occupation. File includes service record card and newspaper clippings.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Infantry Regiment, 341st; United States. Army. Infantry Regiment, 130th (1917-1959)
Topics: Broadhead, Charles E.; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: John Abram Brokaw
Title: John Abram Brokaw file
Description: File documenting the participation of John Abram Brokaw in World War I. Brokaw enlisted on October 23, 1917, and served in the Air Service. Brokaw received training at the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign School of Military Aeronautics and then transferred to Camp Dick, Texas, and later to Kelly Field, Texas. He became an instructor while stationed at Chanute Filed, Illinois, and later at Post Field, Oklahoma, and returned to Taliaferro Field at Camp Dick, Texas. He was sent overseas on September 25, 1918, and was stationed at the 3rd Aviation Instruction Center at Issouden, France. He returned to the States on January 13, 1919. He was discharged on January 23, 1919. File includes a survey, address card, service record car, photographs of Brokaw in uniform, and numerous newspaper clippings, including clippings documenting Brokaw's wedding.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Air Service; University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign. School of Military Aeronautics
Topics: Brokaw, John Abram; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students
Genre/format: questionnaires; cards (information artifacts); photographs; newspaper clippings;

Name: Atwill H. Brookshier
Title: Atwill H. Brookshier file
Description: File documenting the participation of Atwill H. Brookshier in World War I. Atwill enlisted on June 21, 1918, and received training at the Marine Corps Recruit Depot in Parris Island, South Carolina. He transferred to Utica, New York, on August 17, 1918, and then to Quantico, Virginia, on September 15, 1918, where he joined the 11th Regiment. He was sent overseas in October 1918. He was stationed at Gievres, France, and then transferred to Brest, France on July 18, 1919. Atwill returned to the States on August 6, 1919, and was discharged August 11, 1919. File includes survey, address card, service record card, letters, newspaper clipping, and RSVP card.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Marine Corps; Parris Island (S.C. : Recruit depot); United States. Marine Corps. Marine Regiment, 11th
Topics: Brookshier, Atwill H.; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students
Genre/format: questionnaires; cards (information artifacts); newspaper clippings; letters (correspondence); reply cards;

Name: Alfred Orcutt Brown
Title: Alfred Orcutt Brown file
Description: File documenting the participation of Alfred Orcutt Brown in World War I. Brown volunteered for the service on August 23, 1917, and was first stationed at Fort Sheridan, Illinois, in the Second Officers Training Camp. He transferred to Fort Benjamin Harrison, Indiana, to join the 10th Infantry on December 16, 1917. On June 19, 1918, he joined the Machine Gun Training Center at Camp Hancock, Georgia. He was sent overseas on August 24, 1918, as the commanding officer of the Hancock August Replacement Draft. He joined the 148th Machine Gun Battalion while stationed in Selles-sur-Cher, France, on September 11, 1918, and he joined the 164th Infantry while stationed in Contres, France, (modern day Loir-et-Cher) on September 14, 1918. He returned to the States on February 8, 1919, and was discharged on March 3, 1919. File includes a survey, an address card, Brown's service record card, letters, and newspaper clippings. Description supplemented by information from Fold3.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Infantry Regiment, 10th; Machine Gun Training Center (Camp Hancock, Ga.); United States. Army. Machine Gun Battalion, 148th; United States. Army. Infantry Regiment, 164th
Topics: Brown, Alfred Orcutt; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students
Genre/format: questionnaires; reply cards; cards (information artifacts); letters (correspondence); newspaper clippings;

Name: Clifford Allen Brown
Title: Clifford Allen Brown file
Description: File documenting the participation of Clifford Allen Brown in World War I. Brown enlisted on September 18, 1919, and first served with the 349th Infantry at Camp Dodge, Iowa. He transferred to the School of Military Aeronautics at the University of Illinois Champaign-Urbana until he was stationed at Waco, Texas, on January 5, 1918. He joined the Advanced Flying School in Houston, Texas, in June 1918. In September 1918, he joined the Aerial Gunnery at Fort Worth, Texas. File includes survey, Brown's service record card, and several newspaper clippings.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Infantry Regiment, 349th; University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign. School of Military Aeronautics; United States. Army. Air Service;
Topics: Brown, Clifford Allen; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: Edward Sutherland Brown
Title: Edward Sutherland Brown file
Description: File documenting the participation of Edward Sutherland Brown in World War I. Brown enlisted in the Naval Reserve in 1918 and was discharged January 16, 1919. He was stationed at Municipal Pier, Chicago, and later at the naval training station in Cleveland, Ohio. File includes service record card and newspaper clippings. Also includes a series of clippings concerning a car accident that Brown was involved in which resulted in the death of a woman named Julia Frank.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Navy; United States. Naval Reserve
Topics: Brown, Edward Sutherland; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students
Genre/format: index cards; cards (information artifacts); newspaper clippings;

Name: George William Brown
Title: George William Brown file
Description: File documenting the participation of George William Brown in World War I. Brown was drafted on April 3, 1918, and served in the 68th Coast Artillery Corps at Fort H.G. Wright, New York. He was sent overseas on August 9, 1918, and was stationed in a small village outside of Bordeaux, France. He was in St. Pardon, France, after the armistice was signed. He left France on February 17, 1919, and was discharged March 7, 1919. File includes survey, service record card, newspaper clippings, and extensive correspondence from Brown to Ange Milner. Brown was stationed near Bordeaux, France, when many of the letters were written. File also includes the announcement of Brown's wedding.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Coast Artillery Regiment, 68th;
Topics: Brown, George William; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students
Genre/format: questionnaires; cards (information artifacts); letters (correspondence); newspaper clippings; wedding announcements; photographs

Name: Edwin Samuel Burtis
Title: Edwin Samuel Burtis file
Description: File documenting the participation of Edwin Samuel Burtis in World War I. Burtis was drafted in September 1917 and first served in the 349th Infantry at Camp Dodge, Iowa. He transferred to the 33rd Division Military Police at Camp Logan, Texas, in November 1917, and then to the Air Service at Camp Dick, Texas, in February 1918. He was a flying instructor at Love Field, Texas in June 1918, and in November 1918 at Langley Field, Virgina. In December 1918, he transferred to Post Field at Fort Sill, Oklahoma. He was discharged on January 7, 1919. File includes survey, address card, letter, newspaper clippings, and wedding announcement.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Infantry Regiment, 349th; United States. Army. Air Service
Topics: Burtis, Edwin Samuel, 1894-; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students
Genre/format: questionnaires; index cards; cards (information artifacts); letters (correspondence); newspaper clippings; wedding announcements

Name: Royal Victor Burtis
Title: Royal Victor Burtis file
Description: File documenting the participation of Royal Victor Burtis in World War I. Burtis enlisted in March 1918 and first served at Camp Plunkett, Massachusetts, in the Navy. He transferred to Bumkin Island, Massachusetts, on April 20, 1918, and then stationed on the S.S. Fred W. Weller. He joined officers' school at Pelham Bay, New York, on July 30, 1918, and joined the Naval Auxiliary Reserve in New York City on October 5, 1918. Burtis was stationed on the U.S.S. Wachusett on December 19, 1918, until his discharge on October 21, 1919. File includes survey, letters, newspaper clippings, RSVP card, and two postcards Burtis sent while in Singapore.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Navy; U.S. Naval Auxillary Reserve; United States. Naval Reserve;
Topics: Burtis, Royal Victor; World War, 1914-1918; University High School (Normal, Ill.)--Students; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Title: Louis Blackburn Bush file

Name: Charles Henry Butler
Title: Charles Henry Butler file
Description: File documenting the participation of Charles Henry Butler in World War I. Butler enlisted on September 2, 1918, and was first stationed at Camp Grant, Illinois, as a private in the 5th Leading Seamen Regiment and joined the Evacuation Hospital #37 on November 2, 1918. Butler was then sent to France on November 11, 1918 and was stationed at Sebastopol Barracks at Mars-sur-Allier, France. He joined the American Expeditionary Forces University on March 1, 1919. He was sent home on June 15, 1919, and discharged on July 12, 1919. File includes a survey, address cards, letters, and an RSVP card.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Leading Seamen Regiment, 5th; American Expeditionary Forces University (Beaune, France)
Topics: Butler, Charles Henry; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Title: George Earl Cain file
Description: File documenting the participation of George Earl Cain in World War I. Cain enlisted on April 28, 1918. He left Bordeaux, France, in May 1919 and was discharged on June 1, 1919. File includes a survey and a photo.

Name: Percy Burdelle Caley
Title: Percy Burdelle Caley file
Description: File documenting the participation of Percy Burdelle Caley in World War I. He enlisted on April 27, 1917, and served in the 6th Marine Regiment in Quantico, Virginia. He was sent overseas on September 17, 1917, and was stationed in France at Germanvilliers, Sommedieue, Haudiomont, and Belleau Woods. He participated in engagements at Haudiomont in May 1918 and the Battle of Belleau Woods in June 1918. On September 1, 1918, he joined the 202nd Military Police Company in Paris, France, in the pass and permit office. Caley returned to the States on March 25, 1919, and was discharged May 17, 1919. File includes a survey.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Marine Corps; United States. Marine Corps. Marine Regiment, 6th
Topics: Caley, Percy Burdelle, 1896-1972; Belleau Wood, Battle of, France, 1918; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Description: File documenting the participation of Edward J. Canan, Jr. in World War I. Canan was stationed at Camp Joseph E. Johnston in Jacksonville, Florida, in the Quartermasters Corps. Name: John Bruce Carlock
Title: John Bruce Carlock file
Description: File documenting the participation of John Bruce Carlock in World War I. Carlock first served in the Engineering Corps and transferred to the Officer's Training Corps. While at the Vancouver Barracks. He transferred to the 1st Gas Regiment with the 30th Engineers on December 10th, 1917, and was sent overseas on December 16, 1917. He participated in occupations of the Loos, Toul, and Vosges, France, and the battles of Chateau Thierry, Saint Mihiel, and Meuse-Argonne. He returned to the States on January 24, 1918. Name: John Bruce Carlock
Title: John Bruce Carlock file
Description: File documenting the participation of John Bruce Carlock in World War I. Carlock first served in the Engineering Corps and transferred to the Officer's Training Corps. While at the Vancouver Barracks. He transferred to the 1st Gas Regiment with the 30th Engineers on December 10th, 1917, and was sent overseas on December 16, 1917. He participated in occupations of the Loos, Toul, and Vosges, France, and the battles of Chateau Thierry, Saint Mihiel, and Meuse-Argonne. He returned to the States on January 24, 1918. Carlock was discharged on March 15, 1919. File includes a survey, a post card, letters, and newspaper clippings.

Name: Daniel Bernard Carroll
Title: Daniel Bernard Carroll file
Description: File documenting the participation of Daniel Bernard Carroll in World War I. Carroll enlisted on May 12, 1917, and first served at Fort Benjamin Harrison in Indiana in the Officers Training Corps. He transferred to Harvard University and became a Captain of Infantry on August 19, 1917. He transferred to the 309th Ammunition Train at Camp Zachary Taylor in Kentucky on September 27, 1917. He was sent to Camp Sherman, Ohio, on May 8, 1918, and then overseas on September 17, 1918. He had three different hospital stays while overseas from the flu and pneumonia. He returned on January 3, 1919, and was the captain of the 5th Battalion Discharge Unit at Camp Grant, Illinois. Carroll was discharged on February 28, 1919, but recommissioned on April 12, 1919. File includes a survey and a photo.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; Harvard University; United States. Army. Ammunition Train, 309th
Topics: Carroll, Daniel B. (Daniel Bernard), 1886-1959; ; Influenza Epidemic, 1918-1919; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: Chester Arthur Conyers
Title: Chester Arthur Conyers file
Description: File documenting the participation of Chester Arthur Conyers in World War I. Conyers became a captain of the Medical Reserve Corps on July 9, 1918, and was assigned to the 11th Depot Battalion on September 18, 1918, in Fort Leavenworth, Kansas. He was sent to France on November 7, 1918, and transferred to a Replacement Depot to be a supply officer in the surgeon office. He was placed in command of Camp Hospital #87 in Cour Cheverny on February 11, 1918. On February 23, 1919, he transferred to the 113 Field Signal Battalion. He returned to the States on May 6, 1919, and was discharged on June 6, 1919. File includes a survey and a list of dates documenting his military service.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Medical Corps; United States. Army. Replacement Depot; United States. Army. Camp Hospital, 87 (Cour-Cheverny, France)
Topics: Conyers, Chester Arthur; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: Tot William Cooper
Title: Tot William Cooper file
Description: File documenting the participation of Tot William Cooper in World War I. Cooper enlisted on December 11, 1917, and first served at Kelly Field, Texas. He transferred to Eberts Field in Lonoke, Arkansas, on March 1, 1918, to join the 181st Aero Squadron of the Aviation Signal Corps. On June 12, 1918, he transferred to Camp McClennan in Aniston, Alabama. He was sent overseas on June 19, 1918, to the Napoleon Barracks in Brest, France. While in France, he was stationed in the Argonne Forest to build bridges and repair roads during the Meuse-Argonne Offensive. Cooper returned on May 11, 1919, and was discharged on June 4, 1919. File includes an address card, letters, and newspaper clippings. Description supplemented by information from Fold3.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Air Service; United States. Army. Air Service. Aero Squadron, 181st
Topics: Cooper, Tot William; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students
Genre/format: reply cards; cards (information artifacts); letters (correspondence); newspaper clippings;

Name: William Collinson Cooper
Title: William Collinson Cooper file
Description: File documenting the participation of William Collinson Cooper in World War I. Cooper enlisted on December 12, 1917. He first served with the 161st Depot Brigade at Camp Grant, Ilinois. Cooper then transferred to the Aviation Mechanics Training School with the 872 Aero Squadron at St. Paul, Minnesota, on March 15, 1918. On April 19, 1918, Cooper joined the 810 Aero Squadron at Speedway, Indiana. He was discharged on March 25, 1919. File includes surveys, a photo, letters, and newspaper clippings.

Name: James Kenneth Coppenbarger
Title: James Kenneth Coppenbarger file
Description: File documenting the participation of James Kenneth Coppenbarger in World War I. Coppenbarger enlisted on April 16, 1917, and served in the 18th Infantry Regiment. He was sent overseas on June 14, 1917, and participated in the Argonne-Meuse Offensive, the Battle of Chateau-Thierry, the Second Battle of Marne, and the Battle of St. Mihiel. Coppenbarger returned to the States on September 4, 1919, and was discharged within the month. File includes a survey, newspaper clippings, and an RSVP card.

Description: File documenting the participation of James Kenneth Coppenbarger in World War I. Coppenbarger enlisted on April 16, 1917, and served in the 18th Infantry Regiment. He was sent overseas on June 14, 1917, and participated in the Argonne-Meuse Offensive, the Battle of Chateau-Thierry, the Second Battle of Marne, and the Battle of St. Mihiel. Coppenbarger returned to the States on September 4, 1919, and was discharged within the month. File includes a survey, newspaper clippings, and an RSVP card.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Infantry Regiment, 18th
Topics: Coppenbarger, James Kenneth; Argonne, Battle of the, France, 1918; Ch├óteau-Thierry, Battle of, Ch├óteau-Thierry, France, 1918; Marne, 2nd Battle of the, France, 1918; Saint-Mihiel, Battle of, Saint-Mihiel, France, 1918; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students; University High School (Normal, Ill.)--Students

Name: Russell Albert Courtright
Title: Russell Albert Courtright file
Description: File documenting the participation of Russell Albert Courtright in World War I. Courtright enlisted on July 2, 1917, and was first stationed at the Great Lakes Naval Station in Great Lakes, IL, in the Naval Reserve Force. On June 3, 1918, he was transferred to the Bureau of Yards and Docks at Washington D.C. He then served in the Supply Corps in Annapolis, Maryland, on July 15, 1918, and his last station was on the U.S.S. Western Ally in Seattle, Washington. Courtright was discharged on August 31, 1919. File includes a survey, address cards, and newspaper clippings.

Name: Carroll Downey Cox
Title: Carroll Downey Cox file
Description: File documenting the participation of Carroll Downey Cox in World War I. Cox enlisted on April 28, 1917, and served in the Navy Reserves as a Chief Yeoman on the U.S.S. Yantic. He was stationed in Erie, Pennsylvania, transferred to Cleveland, Ohio, in April 1918, and finished his service at the Great Lakes Naval Training Station, Illinois. He was discharged on August 4, 1919. He died on December 13, 1920, from tuberculosis that developed from catching influenza during his service. File includes a survey, address card, photo, letters, and newspaper clippings.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Navy; United States. Naval Reserve
Topics: Cox, Carroll Downey; Influenza Epidemic, 1918-1919; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students
Genre/format: questionnaires; reply cards; photographs; letters (correspondence); newspaper clippings;

Name: Fred H. Cox
Title: Fred H. Cox file
Description: File includes a letter asking Fred H. Cox to provide details on his service in World War I. Cox registered for enlistment on June 5, 1917. He was sent overseas from New York, New York, on September 9, 1918, with the 331st Machine Gun Battalion. He left Brest, France, for Camp Dix, New Jersey, on July 3, 1919, with the 109th Machine Gun Battalion. Description supplemented by information from Fold3.

Name: Thomas Burr Crigler
Title: Thomas Burr Crigler file
Description: File documenting the participation of Thomas Burr Crigler in World War I. Crigler enlisted on August 26, 1917, and was first stationed at Fort Benjamin Harrison, Indiana, to attend the Officer's Training Camp. He transferred on November 29, 1917, to Camp Lee, Virginia, to serve in the Depot Brigade. On June 1, 1918, he transferred to the Machine Gun Training Camp at Camp Hancock, Georgia, instructing others in the Machine Gun Corps. He was discharged on December 7, 1918. File includes a survey, address card, newspaper clippings, and Crigler's marriage announcement.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; Central Machine Gun Officers' Training School (Camp Hancock, Ga.)
Topics: Crigler, Thomas Burr; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students
Genre/format: questionnaires; reply cards; newspaper clippings; wedding announcements;

Name: Irl Addison Crookshank
Title: Irl Addison Crookshank file
Description: File documenting the participation of Irl Addison Crookshank in World War I. Crookshank enlisted on July 20, 1917, and served in the Medical Department at Fort Riley, Kansas. He was sent to France, on September 1, 1918, and was stationed in Chateauroux, France, with the Medical Replacement Unit #33. He returned to the States on August 12, 1919. Crookshank was discharged on September 6, 1919. File includes a survey, address card, postcard, letters, and newspaper clippings.

Name: Clifton Albert Crosby
Title: Clifton Albert Crosby file
Description: File documenting the participation of Clifton Albert Crosby in World War I. Crosby was drafted on May 21, 1918. He first served at Camp Jackson, South Carolina, with the 10th Field Artillery. He joined the Medical Department on July 11, 1918, and joined the 5th Field Artillery on July 12, 1918. On July 25, 1918, he joined the Military Police. Throughtout his service, he was hospitalized multiple times from influenza. Crosby was discharged on February 1, 1919. File includes a survey, letters, a newspaper clipping, and an RSVP card.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Field Artillery; United States. Army. Medical Department;
Topics: Crosby, Clifton Albert; Influenza Epidemic, 1918-1919; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: Frank J. Crosby
Title: Frank J. Crosby file
Description: File documenting the participation of Frank J. Crosby in World War I. Crosby enlisted on May 18, 1918, and served with the 116th Engineers. He started at Valparaiso, Indiana, and then transferred to Tufts College in Boston on June 16, 1918. On August 23, he transferred to Fort Foote, Maryland. He was sent to France on October 20, 1918, and was stationed at the Caserne Desjardins Barracks in Angers, France. Crosby returned to the States on February 23, 1919, and was discharged on March 13, 1919. File includes an address card, a photo, letters, newspaper clippings, and an RSVP card.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Corps of Engineers; United States. Army. Engineer Regiment, 116th; Tufts College
Topics: Crosby, Frank J.; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students
Genre/format: reply cards; photographs; letters (correspondence); newspaper clippings;

Name: Seymer Milton Current
Title: Seymer Milton Current file
Description: File documenting the participation of Seymer Milton Current in World War I. Current enlisted on March 20, 1919, and first served at Camp Johnston, Florida, until May 1, 1918, when he transferred to the 429th Motor Transport Corps at Camp Hill, Virginia. Current was sent overseas on June 30, 1918, and was stationed at La Havre, France, on May 1, 1918. He was sent to the Belleau Woods on April 15, 1919, and returned to the States on July 23, 1919. He was discharged on August 12, 1919. File includes a survey, a photo, letters, newspaper clippings, and RSVP card.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Motor Transport Corps
Topics: Current, Seymer Milton; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: Louis Eddy Davis
Title: Louis Eddy Davis file
Description: File documenting the participation of Louis Eddy Davis in World War I. Davis entered the service in May 1917 and was first stationed at Fort Sheridan, Illinois. He was transferred to the Aviation Corps at Ellington Field in Houston, Texas. Davis died in an airplane accident on May 10, 1918, at Ellington Field. File includes a photo, letters, newspaper clippings, ephemera from his funeral, and a card with a Davis' name with a gold star (used to denote the files of individuals who died in the line of duty).

Name: Roy Trowbridge Deal
Title: Roy Trowbridge Deal file
Description: File documenting the participation of Roy Trowbridge Deal in World War I. He was first stationed at Fort Benjamin Harrison, Indiana, with the Ohio Reserve Guards. He spent four months at Camp Sheridan, Alabama, six weeks at Camp Meade, Maryland, where he joined the Tank Corps, and then transferred to Camp Colt, Pennsylvania for training. He was sent to France on September 25, 1918, with the 302nd Tank Corps and taught at the American Expeditionary Forces University in Beaune, France, after the armistice was signed. Deal returned to the states in July 1919 and was discharged shortly after. File includes address cards, a photo, letters, newspaper clippings, his wedding announcement, a postcard, and envelopes.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; Ohio. National Guard; United States. Army. Tank Corps; United States. Army. Tank Corps, 304th; American Expeditionary Forces University (Beaune, France)
Topics: Deal, Roy Trowbridge; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students
Genre/format: reply cards; photographs; letters (correspondence); newspaper clippings; wedding announcements; postcards; envelopes;

He was sent to France on September 25, 1918, with the 302nd Tank Corps and taught at the American Expeditionary Forces University in Beaune, France, after the armistice was signed. Deal returned to the states in July 1919 and was discharged shortly after. File includes address cards, a photo, letters, newspaper clippings, his wedding announcement, a postcard, and envelopes.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; Ohio. National Guard; United States. Army. Tank Corps; United States. Army. Tank Corps, 304th; American Expeditionary Forces University (Beaune, France)
Topics: Deal, Roy Trowbridge; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: Paul DeMange
Title: Paul DeMange file
Description: File documenting the participation of Paul H. DeMange in World War I. He entered service on May 11, 1917, and first served at Fort Logan H. Roots, Arkansas. He transferred to Camp Pike, Arkansas, on September 1, 1917, and joined the 312th Ammunition Train, 87th Division. He travelled to Camp Dix, New Jersey, and then to Chicago, and back to New Jersey, with 60 Ammunition trucks. He was sent overseas in August 1918, and was stationed at Camp De Souge in Gironde, France, until September 29, when he was sent to Camp Genicart in Bordeaux, France. He would take trucks to the front and back to Bordeaux until December 4, 1918. He was then stationed at St. Vincent, France, until January 6, 1919, when he transferred to Bordeaux to wait to return to the States on February 8, 1919. File includes letters and newspaper clippings.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Ammunition Train, 312th; United States. Army. Division, 87th
Topics: DeMange, Paul H.; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: Harry Lincoln Deutsch
Title: Harry Lincoln Deutsch file
Description: File documenting the participation of Harry Lincoln Deutsch in World War I. Deutsch enlisted on June 2, 1918, and served in the Medical Department at the U.S. General Hospital #42 in Spartanburg, South Carolina. On February 2, 1919, he transferred to Base Hospital #9 at Camp Lee, Virginia. Deutsch was discharged on September 2, 1919. File includes a survey, a letter, newspaper clippings, and an RSVP card.

Name: Herbert William Dice
Title: Herbert William Dice file
Description: File documenting the participation of Herbert William Dice in World War I. Dice was drafted on August 1, 1819, and served in the 809th Pioneer Infantry in Camp Dodge, Iowa. He was sent to St. Nazaire, France, on September 23, 1918, and, after the armistice was signed, he worked in army cemeteries and hospitals. Dice returned to the states on July 20, 1919, and was discharged on July 23, 1919. File includes a survey and photograph of Dice in uniform.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Pioneer Infantry Regiment, 809th
Topics: Dice, Herbert William; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: Guy Leon Dickerson
Title: Guy Leon Dickerson file
Description: File documenting the participation of Guy Leon Dickerson in World War I. Dickerson was drafted on September 5, 1917, and was first stationed at Camp Dodge, Iowa, with the 313th Train Headquarters and Military Police. He transferred to Camp Pike, Arkansas. On August 29, 1918, he left for France with the August Automatic Replacement Draft. He was placed on special duty with the 83rd Division in Le Mans, France. Dickerson returned to the States on February 24, 1919, with the 348th Infantry, and was discharged March 12, 1919. File includes survey and newspaper clipping.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Train Headquarters and Military Police, 313th; United States. Army. Infantry Division, 83rd; United States. Army. Infantry Regiment, 348th
Topics: Dickerson, Guy Leon; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: Oliver Morton Dickerson
Title: Oliver Morton Dickerson file
Description: File documenting the participation of Oliver Morton Dickerson in World War I. Dickerson enlisted May 12, 1917, and served as an officer in the 88th Division in Camp Dodge, Iowa, the 337th Machine Gun Battalion at Camp Dodge, the Machine Gun Training Center at Camp Hancock, Georgia, the 12th Infantry Division at Camp Devens, Massachusetts, the 35th Machine Gun Battalion also at Camp Devens, a professor of Military Science and Tactics at Iowa State Teachers College, and the 2nd Infantry at Camp Dodge. File includes letters and a handwritten and typed response to the survey.

Name: Harry L. Diehl
Title: Harry L. Diehl file
Description: File documenting the participation of Harry L. Diehl in World War I. Diehl enlisted on April 18, 1917, and served in the 337th Infantry at Camp Custer, Michigan. He transferred to Camp Mills, New York, and was sent to France on July 20, 1918, with the 104th Infantry. He was stationed at Winchester, England, Le Harvre, Frace, and Cours-sur-Loire, France. He participated in the St. Mihiel Offensive, the Occupation at the Troyon Sector, and the Meuse-Argonne Offensive. Diehl was discharged on May 20, 1919.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Infantry Regiment, 337th; United States. Army. Infantry Regiment, 104th
Topics: Diehl, Harry L.; Saint-Mihiel, Battle of, Saint-Mihiel, France, 1918; Argonne, Battle of the, France, 1918; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students
Genre/format: questionnaires; cards (information artifacts); postcards; letters (correspondence); newspaper clippings; wedding announcements;

Name: Edgar Nathan Dixon
Title: Edgar Nathan Dixon file
Description: File documenting the participation of Edgar Nathan Dixon in World War I. Dixon enlisted on March 29, 1918, and was first stationed at Camp Dodge, Iowa, in the 88th Division of the Depot Brigade. On April 26, 1918, he was transferred to the 15th Replacement Battalion, and was sent overseas on May 3, 1918, with the 35th Division of the 139th Infantry. He was hospitalized at Base Hospital #91 in Commercy, France for acute bronchitis. He fought in the St. Mihiel and Argonne offensives and was stationed in the trenches near Verdun, France. Dixon returned to the States on April 15, 1919, and was discharged on May 8, 1919. File includes a survey and Dixon's service record card. Description supplemented by information from Fold3.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Depot Brigade, 88th; United States. Army. Infantry Regiment, 139th;
Topics: Dixon, Edgar Nathan; Saint-Mihiel, Battle of, Saint-Mihiel, France, 1918; Argonne, Battle of the, France, 1918; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students;

Name: Thomas Wiley Dobbs
Title: Thomas Wiley Dobbs file
Description: File documenting the participation of Thomas Wiley Dobbs in World War I. Dobbs enlisted June 27, 1918, and served at Camp Taylor, Kentucky with the 158th Infantry. He joined the 153rd Infantry on July 10, 1918, at Camp Beauregard, Louisiana. He was sent overseas on August 3, 1918, and joined the 125th Infantry on September 10, 1918. He participated in the Meuse-Argonne Offensive. Dobbs returned to the states on May 2, 1919, and was discharged May 20, 1919. File includes survey, photograph of Dobbs in uniform, and a map of Normal, Illinois.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Infantry Regiment, 153rd; United States. Army. Infantry Regiment, 125th
Topics: Dobbs, Thomas Wiley; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students; Argonne, Battle of the, France, 1918; World War, 1914-1918--Campaigns--Meuse River Valley

Name: Alfred Marten C. Dohrs
Title: Alfred Marten C. Dohrs file
Description: File documenting the participation of Alfred Marten C. Dohrs in World War I. Dohrs was drafted May 28th, 1918, and served in the 138th Machine Gun Battalion, 38th Division at Camp Shelby, Mississippi. His unit left for France on October 2, 1918. He was hospitalized for the mumps in Nantes, France, in November 1918. He joined the 116th Ammunition Train and returned to the States on February 4, 1919. Dohrs was discharged March 11, 1919. File includes survey and RSVP card. Description supplemented by information from Fold3.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Machine Gun Battalion, 138th; United States. Army. Ammunition Train, 116th
Topics: Dohrs, Alfred Marten C.; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: John Francis Dougherty
Title: John Francis Dougherty file
Description: File documenting the participation of John Francis Dougherty in World War I. Dougherty was a graduate of University High School and enlisted January 2, 1918. He served in the Quartermaster Corps. He was stationed at Camp Humphreys, Virginia, until January 31, 1919, when he was sent to Camp Wadsworth, South Carolina, and then back to Camp Humphreys on March 10, 1919. He was transferred to Camp Grant, Illinois, on April 18, 1919, to join the 160th Depot Brigade. Dougherty was discharged April 25, 1919. File includes a survey.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. War Department. Quartermaster Corps; United States. Army. Depot Brigade, 160th
Topics: Dougherty, John Francis; World War, 1914-1918; University High School (Normal, Ill.)--Students

Name: Lloyd F. Dowell
Title: Lloyd F. Dowell file
Description: File documenting the participation of Lloyd F. Dowell in World War I. Dowell served in the Motor Transport Corps of the Coast Artillery Corps. He was sent overseas in the beginning of 1918 and was stationed in Camp Mailly, France, then sent to Fort Troyon, France. He spent time at the front in Verdun. Dowell was discharged in July 1919. File includes newspaper clippings.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Coast Artillery; United States. Army. Motor Transport Corps

Name: Edwin James Ducey
Title: Edwin James Ducey file
Description: File documenting the participation of Edwin James Ducey in World War I. Ducey enlisted on February 22, 1918. He served in the 309th Engineer Corps first at Camp Taylor, Kentucky, then transferred to Camp Sheridan, Ohio, on July 27, 1918, and he was sent overseas to Montours, France, on October 1, 1918, to build Camp Guthrie. He returned to the States in July 1919 and was discharged on July 18, 1919. File includes a survey.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Corps of Engineers;
Topics: Ducey, Edwin James; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: Gerry Brown Dudley
Title: Gerry Brown Dudley file
Description: File documenting the participation of Gerry Brown Dudley in World War I. Dudley enlisted on August 11, 1917, and was first stationed at Fort Riley, Kansas, in the Medical Officers' Training Corps. He was then sent overseas and stationed at Evacuation Hospital No. 1 in France. During this time, he was involved in the battle of St. Mihiel. On September 26, 1918, Dudley transferred to the 165th Infantry to participate in the Argonne Offensive at Sedan, and Landres-et-Saint-Georges, France. He left France on April 12, 1919, and was discharged on May 20, 1919. File includes a survey and letters. Description supplemented by information from Fold3.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Medical Corps; United States. Army. Infantry Regiment, 165th
Topics: Dudley, Gerry Brown; World War, 1914-1918; Saint-Mihiel, Battle of, Saint-Mihiel, France, 1918; Argonne, Battle of the, France, 1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students;

Name: Richard Charles Dudley
Title: Richard Charles Dudley file
Description: File documenting the participation of Richard Charles Dudley in World War I. Dudley enlisted on August 9, 1918, in the Quartermaster Corps. He was first stationed at Camp Meigs in Washington, D.C., in the Gas and Oil Unit. He left for France on July 23, 1918, and was stationed at Gesvres, Azerailles, and Ranvervillers, France. He was then transferred to the Railhead Service and stationed in Rimaucourt, France, in early 1919. He left for the States on June 17, 1919. File includes a letter and a newspaper clipping.
Related organization/service branch: United States. War Department. Quartermaster Corps;
Topics: Dudley, Richard Charles; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: Thomas M. Eaton
Location: Great Lakes Naval Training Center (Great Lakes, Ill.)
Title: Thomas M. Eaton file
Description: File documenting the participation of Thomas M. Eaton in World War I. Eaton enlisted on June 3, 1918, in the Radio Department of the Navy at the Great Lakes Naval Station in Illinois. He was stationed in New York City and Boston, Massachusetts. File includes a letter, newspaper clippings, and an RSVP card.

Name: Orphus Chester Echols
Title: Orphus Chester Echols file
Description: File documenting the participation of Orphus Chester Echols in World War I. Echols enlisted on September 19, 1917. He first joined the 159th Depot Brigade at Camp Taylor, Kentucky, and was sent overseas on September 1, 1918. He was transferred to the 333rd Infantry while overseas. Once the war ended, Echols stayed near Le Mans, France, with the Rents, Requisitions, and Claims Service. He returned to the States on July 22, 1919, and was discharged on July 30, 1919. File includes a survey, a letter, and a newspaper clipping.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Depot Brigade, 159th; United States. Army. Infantry Regiment, 333rd; United States. Army. American Expeditionary Forces. Army Service Corps. Renting, Requisition, and Claims Service

Name: James Tennant Elliott
Title: James Tennant Elliott file
Description: File documenting the participation of James Tennant Elliott in World War I. Elliott enlisted on May 16, 1917, in the U.S. Marines. He was stationed with the 6th Regiment at Parris Island, South Carolina, and transferred to Quantico, Virginia. He was sent to France in September 1917. He participated in the battles at Verdun, Belleau Woods, Chateau-Thierry, St. Miheil, and Soissons, and in the Meuse-Argonne Offensive and the Pont-a-Mousson Offensive. He left France on July 25, 1919, and was discharged in August 1919. File includes a survey, letters, a postcard, and newspaper clippings.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Marine Corps; United States. Marine Corps. Marine Regiment, 6th;

Location: Great Lakes Naval Training Center (Great Lakes, Ill.)
Title: Julius N. Epstein file
Description: File documenting the participation of Julius N. Epstein in World War I. Epstein enlisted on December 10, 1917. He was stationed at the Great Lakes Naval Training Station in Illinois, in the Radio Service. He transferred to the yeomen service in April 1918. He was discharged May 14, 1918, due to poor health after contracting spinal meningitis. He joined the local recruiting office later in May. File includes letters and newspaper clippings.

Name: Glenn Stewart Evans
Title: Glenn Stewart Evans file
Description: File documenting the participation of Glenn Stewart Evans in World War I. Evans received his commission on June 7, 1917. He trained at Camp Travis, Texas, and was sent overseas on June 20, 1918. He served with the Medical Corps and was attached to the 358th Infantry. He was a battalion surgeon in the Battle of St. Mihiel and in the Meuse-Argonne Offensive. After the armistice was signed, he was stationed in Gerolstein, Germany. File includes letters and newspaper clippings.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Medical Corps; United States. Army. Infantry Regiment, 358th
Topics: Evans, Glenn Stewart; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students; Saint-Mihiel, Battle of, Saint-Mihiel, France, 1918; World War, 1914-1918--Campaigns--Meuse River Valley

Name: Mack Evans
Title: Mack Evans file
Description: File documenting the participation of Mack Evans in World War I. Evans enlisted on May 14, 1917, and was discharged April 22, 1919. He was sent overseas in 1917 and was stationed at Base Hospital no. 12 (also known as Northwestern Hospital Unit) in Camiers, Pas-de-Calais, France. He was hospitalized at the British Etables army base camp in the Pas de Calais region for scarlet fever in December 1917 and diphtheria in April 1918. Evans returned on March 26, 1919. File includes a survey, letters, postcard, newspaper clippings, and a ticket to a concert at Illinois State Normal University in which Evans played the organ.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Base Hospital No. 12
Topics: Evans, Mack, 1894-; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students
Genre/format: questionnaires; letters (correspondence); postcards; newspaper clippings; admission tickets

Name: Louie Dick Fanselow
Title: Louie Dick Fanselow file
Description: File documenting the participation of Louie Dick Fanselow in World War I. Fanselow, a University High School graduate, enlisted on April 20, 1918, and served in the Quartermaster Corps and the 322nd Field Remount Squadron. He was stationed at Camp Johnston, Florida, from June 18 to July 8, 1918, and at Camp Stuart, Virginia, starting July 21, before he was sent overseas on September 8, 1918. He was stationed overseas at Remount Depot no. 7 in Merignac, France. Fanselow returned on June 28, 1919. File includes two surveys. Description supplemented by information from Fold3.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. War Dept. Quartermaster Corps; United States. Army. Field Remount Squadron, 322nd
Topics: Fanselow, Louie Dick; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

He was stationed at Camp Johnston, Florida, from June 18 to July 8, 1918, and at Camp Stuart, Virginia, starting July 21, before he was sent overseas on September 8, 1918. He was stationed overseas at Remount Depot no. 7 in Merignac, France. Fanselow returned on June 28, 1919. File includes two surveys. Description supplemented by information from Fold3.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. War Dept. Quartermaster Corps; United States. Army. Field Remount Squadron, 322nd
Topics: Fanselow, Louie Dick; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: Arthur Eugene Farrell
Location: Great Lakes Naval Training Center (Great Lakes, Ill.)
Title: Arthur Eugene Farrell file
Description: File documenting the participation of Arthur Eugene Farrell in World War I. Farrell enlisted on July 24, 1917, and was stationed at the Great Lakes Naval Training Center in Illinois in the Yeomen service. On November 4, 1917, he was transferred to Cleveland, Ohio, for cadet training on the S.S. Sullivan. On February 24, 1018, he transferred to the Pelham Bay Naval Training Station at Pelham Bay, New York. He was transferred to the Naval Overseas Transportation Service on the U.S.S. Santa Olivia on May 18, 1918. He was released from active duty on December 23, 1918, but remained in the Naval Reserve Force. File includes a note from Farrell documenting his service, a letter, and newspaper clippings.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Navy; United States. Naval Reserve;
Topics: Farrell, Arthur Eugene; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students; University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign--Students

Name: John Lester Feek
Title: John Lester Feek file
Description: File documenting the participation of John Lester Feek in World War I. Feek enlisted on January 2, 1918, and was first stationed at Camp Johnston, Florida, in the Quartermaster Corps. He oversaw the camp library until August 1, 1918, when he joined the Training Department as an instructor. On September 11, 1918, he transferred to Jefferson Barracks in St. Louis. He was sent to France on October 20, and was stationed at Base Hospital #131. He also taught at the American Expeditionary Forces University in Beaune, France. He returned to the states on June 29, 1919, and was discharged on July 8, 1919. He contracted tuberculosis in the beginning of 1923 and died on January 13, 1924. File includes surveys, address cards, photos, a postcard, letters, and newspaper clippings.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. War Dept. Quartermaster Corps; United States. Army. Base Hospital No. 131; American Expeditionary Forces University (Beaune, France)
Topics: Feek, John Lester;World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students; University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign--Students
Genre/format: questionnaires; reply cards; photographs; letters (correspondence); postcards; newspaper clippings;

Name: John Benjamin Felmley
Location: Great Lakes Naval Training Center (Great Lakes, Ill.)
Title: John Benjamin Felmley file
Description: File documenting the participation of John Benjamin Felmley in World War I. Felmley enlisted on July 18, 1917, and was stationed at Great Lakes Naval Training Center in Great Lakes, Illinois, in the Navy Reserves Force. He was the captain of the Great Lakes basketball team at the training station. He was a carpenter's mate until August 25, 1918, when he was promoted to Warrant Carpenter. Felmley was discharged on July 2, 1919. File includes a survey, photos, newspaper clippings, an RSVP card, and a newspaper clipping about Lieutenant J. L. Feck.

Name: Merle George Ferree
Title: Merle George Ferree file
Description: File documenting the participation of Merle George Ferree in World War I. Ferree enlisted on May 20, 1918, and was first stationed at Camp Shelby in Hattiesburg, Mississippi, in the 38th Division of the Machine Gun Corps and the 149th Infantry. He left for Nantes, France, on October 2, 1918, and fought in the Meuse-Argonne Offensive. Ferree returned on July 18, 1919, and was discharged on July 26, 1919. File includes a survey, a letter, and an RSVP card.

Name: John Fisherkeller
Title: John Fisherkeller file
Description: File documenting the participation of John Fisherkeller in World War I. Fisherkeller was first stationed at Camp Forrest, Georgia, and served with the 122nd Engineers. He was sent to France on October 21, 1919. The unit was responsible for construction all over France, and they built the Pershing Stadium in Paris, France. Fisherkeller returned July 12, 1919., and was discharged in July 1919. File includes notes on his service and newspaper clippings. Description supplemented by information from Fold3.

Name: Birney Fifer Fleming
Title: Birney Fifer Fleming file
Description: File documenting the participation of Birney Fifer Fleming in World War I. Fleming enlisted on May 8, 1917, and served with the 11th Aero Service Squadron. He was first stationed in San Antonio, Texas, then transferred to Belleville, Illinois. He was sent overseas on December 17, 1917, and stationed in Stamford, England. On August 4, 1918, he was sent to France and served in the Battle of St. Mihiel and the Argonne-Meuse Offensive. Fleming returned home on April 21, 1919, and was discharged May 21, 1919. File includes a survey, a letter, and newspaper clippings.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Air Service; United States. Army. Air Service. Aero Squadron, 11th
Topics: Fleming, Birney Fifer; Saint-Mihiel, Battle of, Saint-Mihiel, France, 1918; Argonne, Battle of the, France, 1918; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: Clarence Lowell Foiles
Title: Clarence Lowell Foiles file
Description: File documenting the participation of Clarence Lowell Foiles in World War I. Foiles enlisted on December 30, 1917, and was first stationed at the Vancouver Barracks for training. He was sent overseas on May 8, 1918, with the 318th Engineers and was stationed at Gievres Intermediate Supply Depot, France. He was a part of the Meuse-Argonne Offensive (November 2 to November 9, 1918) and the Army of Occupation (May 1 to May 20, 1919). Foiles left for the States on June 3, 1919, and was discharged June 21, 1919. File includes survey and photograph of Foiles in uniform.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Engineer Regiment, 318th

Name: Wilfred Henry Gardner
Title: Wilfred Henry Gardner file
Description: File documenting the participation of Wilfred Henry Gardner in World War I. Gardner enlisted on May 21, 1917, and was first stationed at the 365th Field Hospital at Fort Riley, Kansas. In April 1918, he transferred to Camp Funston, Kansas, to be the director of the field hospital. He was sent to France on June 19, 1918, where he was the Lieutenant Colonel of the 317th Sanitary Train. He served in the Battle of St. Mihiel and the Meuse-Argonne Offensive. After the war ended, he was stationed at Is-sur-Tille, France. Gardner returned on July 7, 1919, and was discharged shortly after. File includes a survey, a photo, a letter, and newspaper clippings.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Medical Department; United States. Army. Field Hospital, 365th
Topics: Gardner, Wilfred Henry; Saint-Mihiel, Battle of, Saint-Mihiel, France, 1918; Argonne, Battle of the, France, 1918; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: Arthur L. Garman
Title: Arthur L. Garman file
Description: File documenting the participation of Arthur L. Garman in World War I. Garman enlisted in May 1917 and was first stationed with the 58th Engineers. He joined the Quartermaster Corps when he went overseas on August 6, 1917. In September 1917, he was stationed at Is-Sur-Tille, France. He fought in the Vosges Front and in the Alsace-Lorraine region in 1918. He left France on July 9, 1919, and was discharged shortly after. File includes a photo, a letter, newspaper clippings, and an RSVP card.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Engineer Regiment, 58th; United States. War Dept. Quartermaster Corps;
Topics: Garner, Arthur L.; Vosges, Battle of the, France, 1918; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students; Illinois Wesleyan University--Students

Name: Hugh Wells Garnett
Title: Hugh Wells Garnett file
Description: File documenting the participation of Hugh Wells Garnett in World War I. Garnett enlisted in July 1918 and was stationed at Camp Meigs in Washington, D.C. In 1919, he started working at the Walter Reed Hospital, and was discharged on February 1, 1919. File includes a survey.

Name: Alwin George Gasser
Location: Great Lakes Naval Training Center (Great Lakes, Ill.)
Title: Alwin George Gasser file
Description: File documenting the participation of Alwin George Gasser in World War I. Gasser enlisted on April 18, 1918, and was stationed at the Great Lakes Naval Training Station at Great Lakes, Illinois, in the Navy Reserves. He transferred to the Norfolk Naval Base in Virginia on August 15, 1918. He was then stationed on different ships as a fireman until he was discharged on November 21, 1919. Gasser started on the U.S.S. Indiana on October 15, 1918, then transferred to the U.S.S. Teresa on November 3, 1918, and then transferred to the U.S.S. Westbridge on March 4, 1919, where he ended his enlistment. File includes a survey, a photo, and a letter.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Navy; United States. Naval Reserve;
Topics: Gasser, Alwin George; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: William Blaine Geneva
Title: William Blaine Geneva file
Description: File documenting the participation of William Blaine Geneva in World War I. Geneva enlisted on August 27, 1917, and was first stationed at Fort Sheridan, Illinois. On December 15, 1917, he transferred to the 163rd Depot Brigade at Camp Dodge, Iowa. He joined the 349th Infantry on January 5, 1918, rejoined the 163rd Depot Brigade in May 1918, and joined the 804th Pioneer Infantry in June 1918. Geneva was sent to France on September 8, 1918, and stationed around Pont-a-Mousson, France. He participated in the Meuse-Argonne Offensive. Geneva eturned on July 15, 1919, and was discharged on August 8, 1919. File includes a survey, address card, a photo, letters, and newspaper clippings.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Depot Brigade, 163rd; United States. Army. Pioneer Infantry Regiment, 803rd
Topics: Geneva, William Blaine; Argonne, Battle of the, France, 1918; World War, 1914-1918; Bloomington High School (Bloomington, Ill.)--Students; Illinois State Normal University--Students
Genre/format: questionnaires; reply cards; cards (information artifacts); letters (correspondence); newspaper clippings;

Name: Alice Edith Gent
Title: Alice Edith Gent file
Description: File documenting the participation of Alice Edith Gent in World War I. Gent enlisted in November 1918 to serve with the Y.M.C.A. and served in the Canteen Service at Camp Federes in Brest, France. She also served as the Hostess of Convalescent Home at Chateau Kerguillau in Brittany, France. Gent was discharged in September 1919. File includes her service record card.
Related organization/service branch: YMCA of the USA;

Name: John Robert Giberson
Title: John Robert Giberson file
Description: File documenting the participation of John Robert Giberson in World War I. Giberson enlisted on June 9, 1917, and was first stationed in Louisville, Kentucky, in the Auxiliary Remount Depot. He joined the Quartermasters Corps on December 30, 1917. He transferred to Camp Gordon, Georgia, to join the 5th Replacement Regiment on August 1, 1918. On September 1, 1918, he was sent to Camp Perry, Ohio, to enter the Small Arms Firing School, and was then sent to Camp Kearney, California, on October 10, 1918, to join the 40th Division of the Recruit Depot. On April 1, 1919, Giberson joined the 47th Machine Gun Battalion and was discharged on March 1, 1920. File includes a survey, letters, and newspaper clippings.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Auxiliary Remount Depot; United States. War Dept. Quartermaster Corps; Small Arms Firing School (Camp Perry, Ohio); United States. Army. Recruit Depot; United States. Army. Machine Gun Battalion, 47th
Topics: Giberson, John Robert; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: Hallie H. Gillis
Title: Hallie H. Gillis file
Description: File documenting the participation of Hallie H. Gillis in World War I. Gillis enlisted on May 7, 1917, and was first stationed at Fort Howard, Maryland with the 2nd Coastal Artillery Corps. On October 16, 1917, he was transferred to Camp Taylor, Kentucky, to join the 325th Machine Gun Battalion. On May 17, 1918, he joined the Officers Training School, and, on July 15, 1918, he joined the Central Machine Gun Officers Training School at Camp Hancock, Georgia. On October 16, 1918, he joined the Machine Training Division. Gillis was discharged on December 13, 1918. File includes a survey, a photo, letters, newspaper clippings, and an RSVP card.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Coast Artillery Corps. Company, 2nd; Central Machine Gun Officers' Training School (Camp Hancock, Ga.)
Topics: Gillis, Hallie H.; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Title: James Ernest Glossop file
Description: File documenting the participation of James Ernest Glossop in World War I. Glossop enlisted on September 5, 1917, and served at the field hospital in Camp Taylor, Kentucky, with the 309th Sanitary Train. He transferred to Camp Pike, Arkansas, to serve with the 346th Infantry on November 15, 1917. He was sent overseas on September 1, 1918, and returned on March 15, 1919. When the war ended, he stayed in St. Nazaire, France, until he was discharged on April 17, 1919. File includes a survey.

File includes photograph of Greene, postcard, and newspaper clippings, including several newspaper articles that reproduce excerpts of letters from Greene commenting on conditions at Fort Monroe. One excerpt includes lengthy description of gas mask training.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Coast Artillery;
Topics: Greene, Chester; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: Lorne Greenlee
Title: Lorne Greenlee file
Description: File documenting the participation of Lorne Greenlee in World War I. Greenlee enlisted May 29, 1918, and was sent first to Dallas, Texas, and later to Princeton, New Jersey, where he studied engines and motors for aviation work in the Air Service. He returned to Dallas and was discharged near the end of the war. File includes a letter.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Air Service;
Topics: Greenlee, Lorne; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: George Gresham Griggs
Title: George Gresham Griggs file
Description: File documenting the participation of George Gresham Griggs in World War I. Griggs enlisted on May 15, 1917, at was first stationed at the Fort Sheridan Training Camp in Illinois. On December 24, 1917, he transferred to Camp Hancock, Georgia, to the 2nd Motor Mechanics Regiment. He was sent to St. Aignan, France, on February 20, 1918, with the 1st Depot Division. He became Captain of the 163rd Infantry Corps of Engineers on October 23, 1918, at Montrichard, France, and returned to the states on February 12, 1919. Griggs was discharged on February 24, 1919. File includes a survey, letters, newspaper clippings, and Griggs' marriage certificate.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Motor Mechanics, 2nd; United States. Army. Depot Division, 1st; United States. Army. Infantry Regiment, 163rd
Topics: Griggs, George Gresham; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students
Genre/format: questionnaires; letters (correspondence); newspaper clippings; wedding announcements;

Name: Eugene Charles Grossmann
Title: Eugene Charles Grossmann file
Description: File documenting the participation of Eugene Charles Grossmann in World War I. Grossmann enlisted on April 29, 1918, and was first stationed at Camp Dix, New Jersey, in the 308th Field Artillery. He was sent overseas on May 25, 1918, and stationed at Camp De Meucon in Brittany, France. He fought in the Battle of St. Mihiel and the Meuse-Argonne Offensive. He was transferred to the 76th Field Artillery after the war ended and stationed in Thur, Germany. Grossmann returned to the States on August 23, 1919, and was discharged on August 30, 1919. File includes a survey and a photo.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Field Artillery Battalion, 308th; United States. Army. Field Artillery Regiment, 76th
Topics: Grossmann, Eugene Charles; Saint-Mihiel, Battle of, Saint-Mihiel, France, 1918; Argonne, Battle of the, France, 1918; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: Frank Oral Grounds
Title: Frank Oral Grounds file
Description: File documenting the participation of Frank Oral Grounds in World War I. Grounds enlisted on July 30, 1917, and was first stationed in Syracuse, New York, in the Quartermasters Corps. He served in 6th Casual Company and transferred to the 18th Casual Company as the Acting Mess Sergeant on August 2, 1917. On November 4th, 1917, he transferred to Camp Hancock, Georgia, to the 10th Casual Company to serve as a cook and trained other cooks and bakers. He joined the Headquarters Supply Company on November 19, 1917. Grounds was discharged on February 14, 1918. File includes a survey and address card.
Related organization/service branch: United States. War Dept. Quartermaster Corps;
Topics: Grounds, Frank Oral; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Related organization/service branch: United States. Navy; United States. Naval Radio Service;

Name: Robert Willis Grubb
Title: Robert Willis Grubb file
Description: File documenting the participation of Robert Willis Grubb in World War I. Grubb enlisted on July 2, 1917, in the Navy and was first stationed in Chicago, then at Great Lakes Training Station. He transferred to Cambridge, Massachusetts, to join the Harvard Radio School in May 1918. That same month, he was sent to Sea Training Camp on Bumkin Island, Massachusetts, and then joined the Harvard Cadet School in August 1918. In November 1918, he got his first assignment on the U.S.S.T.R. #40 in November 1918, then the U.S.S. Henderson in February 1919, and the U.S.S. Yale in June 1919. Grubb was discharged on June 10, 1920. File includes a survey, address cards, photos, letters, a postcard, and newspaper clippings.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Navy; United States. Naval Training School (Harvard University)
Topics: Grubb, Robert Willis; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students; University High School (Normal, Ill.)--Students;
Genre/format: questionnaires; reply cards; photographs; letters (correspondence); postcards; newspaper clippings;
