Name: Otto Hugo Guenther
Title: Otto Hugo Guenther file
Description: File documenting the participation of Otto Hugo Guenther in World War I. Geunther enlisted on December 7, 1917, and was first stationed at Newport News, Virginia, in the 4th regiment of the Infantry in the Medical Department. He arrived in France on April 15, 1918, and served in the 2nd Battle of Marne, Battle of Ch├óteau-Thierry, and the Meuse-Argonne Offensive. He was injured during the Battle of Ch├óteau-Thierry when he removed his gas mask too soon after a gas shells attack, and later he got shrapnel in his knee at the Meuse-Argonne Offensive. He was sent back to the states to General Hospital #28 at Fort Sheridan, Illinois, on December 16, 1918, to be treated for his injuries. Geunther was discharged on September 19, 1919. File includes a survey, a photo, letters, a postcard, and newspaper clippings.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Infantry Regiment, 4th; United States. Army. Medical Department;
Topics: Guenther, Otto Hugo; Marne, 2nd Battle of the, France, 1918; Ch├óteau-Thierry, Battle of, Ch├óteau-Thierry, France, 1918; Argonne, Battle of the, France, 1918; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students
Genre/format: questionnaires; photographs; letters (correspondence); postcards; newspaper clippings;

Title: Linder William Hacker file
Description: File documenting the participation of Linder William Hacker in World War I. File includes survey, two photos of Hacker in uniform, newspaper clippings, and two letters, including a lengthy letter discussing conditions related to the influenza epidemic in New York State.

Name: Robert Emmet Haines
Title: Robert Emmet Haines file
Description: File documenting the participation of Robert Emmet Haines in World War I. He was first stationed at Lake Geneva, Wisconsin, at the Y.M.C.A. College. He was sent to France to continue working with the Y.M.C.A. and teach at the American Expeditionary Forces University. He returned home after a year, and died on June 4, 1921, from cancer. File includes address cards, letters, and newspaper clippings.
Related organization/service branch: YMCA of the USA; American Expeditionary Forces University (Beaune, France);
Topics: Haines, Robert Emmet; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: Arthur Coleman Hall
Title: Arthur Coleman Hall file
Description: File documenting the participation of Arthur Coleman Hall in World War I. Hall served with the YMCA from August 1918 to January 18, 1919. He was an athletic and recreational director with the Third Italian Army, headquartered at Mogliano, Italy, and later Trieste, Italy. Hall was with the Italian troops when they were engaged in the 2nd Battle of the Piave, in October 1918. File includes survey, photograph of Hall in uniform, and letter.
Related organization/service branch: YMCA of the USA; Italy. Esercito. Armata, terza
Topics: Hall, Arthur Coleman; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students; Piave, 2nd Battle of the, Italy, 1918

Name: Chester Malcolm Hammerlund
Title: Chester Malcolm Hammerlund file
Description: File documenting the participation of Chester Malcolm Hammerlund in World War I. Hammerlund enlisted on September 18, 1917, and served in the 349th Infantry (Camp Dodge, Iowa), the 346th Infantry (Camp Pike, Arkansas), the Small Arms Firing School at Camp Perry, Ohio, and the 3rd and 4th Development Battalions (Camp Perry and Camp MacArthur, Texas). He was discharged December 13, 1918. File includes survey, photograph of Hammerlund in uniform, newspaper clippings, and an RSVP card.

Name: Archie Milton Hanson
Title: Archie Milton Hanson file
Description: File documenting the participation of Archie Milton Hanson in World War I. Hanson enlisted on November 23, 1917, and was first stationed in Austin in the Air Service and was transferred to Camp John Dick Aviation Concentration Camp in Dallas in May 1918. In July, he transferred to Rantoul, Illinois, and was sent back to Camp Dick later that month. In August 1918, Hanson was sent to the Wilbur Wright Field in Dayton, Ohio, and on September 15th, 1918, he was sent to Garden City, New York, to prepare to go overseas. He left on October 24 and arrived in Issoudun Field, France, on October 28, 1918. He returned on January 21, 1919, and was discharged on February 22, 1919. File includes a survey, address cards, a photo, newspaper clippings, and an RSVP card.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Air Service;
Topics: Hanson, Archie Milton; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students
Genre/format: questionnaires; reply cards; photographs; newspaper clippings;

Name: Howard Henry Hardy
Title: Howard Henry Hardy file
Description: File documenting the participation of Howard Henry Hardy in World War I. Hardy enlisted June 24, 1918. He served in Company G, 124th Infantry, 31st Division at Camp Wheeler, Georgia, and Camp Mills, New York. He died from pneumonia on October 20, 1918 at Camp Mills, while waiting to be sent overseas. File includes note card, photograph of Hardy in uniform, letters, and a card with Hardy's name and a gold star (used to denote the files of individuals who died in the line of duty).

Name: Leon Harpole
Title: Leon Harpole file
Description: File documenting the participation of Leon Harpole in World War I. Harpole enlisted on July 25, 1917, and was first stationed at Camp Colt in Gettysburg, Pennsylvania. He transferred to Camp Greene in North Carolina, in November 1917. He was sent to France on May 3, 1918, and served as assistant band leader in the 59th Infantry. He left Brest, France, on July 9, 1919. File includes a signature card, letters, postcards, and newspaper clippings. Description supplemented with information from Fold3.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Infantry Regiment, 59th
Topics: Harpole, Leon; Bands (Music); World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: Ralph Orin Harpole
Title: Ralph Orin Harpole file
Description: File documenting the participation of Ralph Orin Harpole in World War I. He enlisted in the Quartermasters Corps and was first stationed at Fort Sheridan, Illinois. He transferred to Fort Oglethorpe, Georgia, to join the 54th Infantry. He was transferred to Camp Wadsworth, South Carolina, on May 7, 1918, and was sent to France on July 4, 1918. He was injured on September 6, 1918, and was sent to different hospitals. He was in Bordeaux at the time of the Armistice. Harpole returned to the states in June 1918 and was discharged shortly after. File includes an address card, letters, and newspaper clippings.
Related organization/service branch: United States. War Dept. Quartermaster Corps; United States. Army; United States. Army. Infantry Regiment, 54th
Topics: Harpole, Ralph Orin; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: Wilburn R. Harrell
Title: Wilburn R. Harrell file
Description: File documenting the participation of Wilburn R. Harrell in World War I. Harrell enlisted on August 1, 1917, and was first stationed at Jefferson Barracks in St. Louis in the General Service Infantry. On August 13, 1917, he transferred to Kelley Field in Texas to join the 73rd Aero Squadron. He transferred to Newport News, Virginia, on December 20, 1917, and joined the 647th Aero Squadron on February 26, 1918. He was discharged on December 24, 1918. File includes a survey and letter.

Name: Fred Hartin
Title: Fred Hartin file
Description: File documenting the participation of Fred Hartin in World War I. Hartin enlisted on April 3, 1918, and was first stationed at Fort H.G. Wright, New York, with the 5th Coast Artillery Corps. He transferred to the 68th Coast Artillery Corps in July 1918, and was sent to Fort Terry, New York, on August 7, 1918. Hartin was sent overseas on August 29, 1918, and stationed in Vayres, France, in October 1918. In December 1918, he was stationed in St. Pardon. He returned to the States on February 15, 1919, and was discharged March 6, 1919. File includes a survey, a photo, clippings, and an RSVP card.

Name: Strode Pemberton Henderson
Title: Strode Pemberton Henderson file
Description: File documenting the participation of Strode Pemberton Henderson in World War I. Henderson was first stationed at Camp Grant, Illinois, with the Military Police. He transferred to Camp Johnston, Florida, for officer's training in May 1918. On July 10, 1918, he joined the Quartermaster's Corps and took several round trips from Newport News, Virginia, to Bordeaux, France, Rotterdam, Netherlands, and Liverpool, England. Henderson was discharged on March 15, 1919, and died on January 31, 1920, from a short battle with pneumonia. File includes a survey, letter, and newspaper clippings.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. War Dept. Quartermaster Corps;
Topics: Henderson, Strode Pemberton; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students; Bloomington High School (Bloomington, Ill.)--Students;

Name: Paul Frederick Hoierman
Location: Great Lakes Naval Training Center (Great Lakes, Ill.)
Title: Paul Frederick Hoierman file
Description: File documenting the participation of Paul Frederick Hoierman in World War I. Hoierman enlisted on December 12, 1917, and was first stationed at Great Lakes Naval Training Center, Illinois, in the Navy Reserves. He was assigned to the U.S.S. Daniel J. Morell for training in Ashtabula, Ohio, on September 12, 1918, and was sent to Cleveland on October 24, 1918. He was sent to Municipal Pier in Chicago on November 2, 1918, and, on January 7, 1919, he was sent to Pelham Bay Naval Training Center, New York, to join the Quartermaster's Corps. Hoierman was discharged on April 30, 1919. File includes a survey, letters, postcards, and newspaper clippings.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Navy; United States. Naval Reserve; United States. War Dept. Quartermaster Corps;
Topics: Hoierman, Paul Frederick; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students; Bloomington High School (Bloomington, Ill.)--Students;

Name: Parker Manfred Holmes
Location: Great Lakes Naval Training Center (Great Lakes, Ill.)
Title: Parker Manfred Holmes file
Description: File documenting the participation of Parker Manfred Holmes in World War I. Holmes enlisted on November 12, 1917, and was stationed at Great Lakes Naval Training Center from January to March 1918. He transferred to Municipal Pier, Chicago, until August 1918. He then went to Cleveland, Ohio, to be stationed on the U.S.S. Francis Widlar until July 1918. He joined the Quartermaster's Corps while stationed at Pelham Bay Naval Training Center, and joined the U.S.S. Aniwa, which served as a cargo ship from New York to Genoa, Italy. Name: Reid B. Horney
Title: Reid B. Horney file
Description: File documenting the participation of Reid B. Horney in World War I. Horney enlisted on August 2, 1917. He was first stationed at Kelly Field in Austin, Texas, to join the Air Service. He transferred to Camp Dick in Dallas on February 16, 1918, and returned to Kelly Field on April 12, 1918, to become a drill sergeant. On August 18, 1918, he transferred to Brooks Field in San Antonio to become a flight instructor. Horney then went to Chanute Field in Rantoul, Illinois, on September 30, 1918, and ended his service at Payne Field near West Point, Mississippi when he was discharged on January 6, 1919. File includes a photo, letters, and newspaper clippings.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Air Service;
Topics: Horney, Reid B.; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: Cecil Oswell Horton
Title: Cecil Oswell Horton file
Description: File documenting the participation of Cecil Oswell Horton in World War I. Horton enlisted on May 2, 1918, and was stationed at Camp Dix, New Jersey, in the 309th Heavy Field Artillery. He left for France on June 4, 1918, and was stationed at Vannes, France, then Verdun, France. He participated in the Battle of St. Mihiel, and the Meuse-Argonne Offensive from October 18 to November 11, 1918. File includes a survey, letters, and an RSVP card.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Heavy Field Artillery, 309th
Topics: Horton, Cecil Oswell; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: Tony Clovous Hostettler
Title: Tony Clovous Hostettler file
Description: File documenting the participation of Tony Clovous Hostettler in World War I. Hostettler enlisted on August 9, 1917, and was first stationed at Kelly Field, Texas, with the 92nd Aero Squadron. He was sent overseas on October 13, 1917, and was stationed at Camp Waddington in England. He became an air mechanic while stationed in Ford Junction, England. He returned to the States in 1918 and was discharged on December 20, 1918. File includes a survey, postcard, newspaper clipping, RSVP card, and a card with Hostettler's signature.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Air Service; United States. Army. Air Service. Aero Squadron, 92nd
Topics: Hostettler, Tony Clovous; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: Gordon Kirk Howard
Title: Gordon Kirk Howard file
Description: File documenting the participation of Gordon Kirk Howard in World War I. Howard enlisted on June 4, 1918, and was first stationed in Allentown, Pennsylvania, with Base Hospital 82. He was sent to France on August 31, 1918, and returned to the States on May 28, 1919. While in Brest, France, he was hospitalized for the flu on September 6, 1918. Howard was discharged on June 17, 1919. File includes a survey and newspaper clippings. Description supplemented by information from Fold3.

Name: William Nelson Howard
Title: William Nelson Howard file
Description: File documenting the participation of William Nelson Howard in World War I. Howard enlisted on November 1, 1918, and first attended ordnance training school at the University of Chicago. He was stationed in San Antonio, Texas, on January 10, 1918, and then transferred to Camp Hancock, Georgia, to join the Ordnance Department on April 1, 1918. He was sent overseas on May 27, 1918, and was stationed at St. Loubes, France. He attended the University of Bordeaux. Howard left France on June 23, 1919, and was discharged on July 18, 1919. File includes a survey, letters, and newspaper clippings. Description supplemented by information from Fold3.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; University of Chicago; United States. Army. Ordnance Department; Université de Bordeaux (1441-1970)

Title: Nicholas Leo Hubbard file

Name: John Albert Hubbell
Title: John Albert Hubbell file
Description: File documenting the participation of John Albert Hubbell in World War I. Hubbell enlisted on March 28, 1917, and was first stationed in Decatur, Illinois, with the 5th Illinois Infantry. He transferred to Houston, Texas, on October 10, 1917, to join the 124th Machine Gun Battalion. On March 1, 1918, he was sent to Camp Logan, Illinois, and then to France on May 6, 1918. He participated in the Second Battle of Albert and in the Meuse-Argonne Offensive. Hubbell returned to the States on October 15, 1918, and was discharged on May 17, 1919. File includes a survey, letter, and newspaper clippings.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Illinois Infantry Regiment, 5th; United States. Army. Machine Gun Battalion, 124th
Topics: Hubbell, John Albert; Argonne, Battle of the, France, 1918; Somme, 2nd Battle of the, France, 1918; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

He participated in the Second Battle of Albert and in the Meuse-Argonne Offensive. Hubbell returned to the States on October 15, 1918, and was discharged on May 17, 1919. File includes a survey, letter, and newspaper clippings.

Name: Robert R. Hudelson
Title: Robert R. Hudelson file
Description: File documenting the participation of Robert R. Hudelson in World War I. Hudelson enlisted on August 27, 1919, and was first stationed at Fort Sheridan, Illinois, with the First Training Battery. He transferred to the 314th Field Artillery at Camp Lee, Virginia, on December 12, 1917, and, on September 9, 1918, he was sent to Camp Funston, Kansas, to join the 28th Field Artillery. Hudelson spent three months in France, left the country from Brest, and was discharged on January 20, 1919. File includes a survey and newspaper clipping.

Name: Bert Hudgins
Location: Great Lakes Naval Training Center (Great Lakes, Ill.)
Title: Bert Hudgins file
Description: File documenting the participation of Bert Hudgins in World War I. Hudgins enlisted on April 9, 1918, and was stationed at Great Lakes Naval Training Center, Illinois. In August 1918, he transferred to Harvard University to attend the Naval Training School to become a Radio Electrician. On October 28, he was hospitalized for influenza and rheumatism and stayed there until his discharge on December 18, 1918. File includes a survey, photo, letters, a postcard, and newspaper clippings.

Name: Glenn Evans Hudson
Title: Glenn Evans Hudson file
Description: File documenting the participation of Glenn Evans Hudson in World War I. Hudson enlisted on September 4, 1917, and was first stationed at Camp Dodge with the 349th Infantry. He transferred to Camp Pike and Camp Dix on November 13 to join the 346th Infantry. He was sent overseas on August 24, 1918, and was stationed in Longre, France. While overseas, he was discharged from the Army to join Herbet Hoover's staff in Paris in the Food Administration and the American Relief Administration. File includes a survey, photo, and an RSVP card.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Infantry Regiment, 349th; United States. Army. Infantry Regiment, 346th; United States Food Administration; American Relief Administration
Topics: Hudson, Glenn Evans; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: Robert Benjamin Huffman
Title: Robert Benjamin Huffman file
Description: File documenting the participation of Robert Benjamin Huffman in World War I. Huffman enlisted on December 10, 1917, and was first stationed at Fort Logan, Colorado. On January 19, 1918, he transferred to Camp Stanley, Texas, to join the 20th Field Artillery. He was later transferred to Camp MacArthur, Texas, and joined the Signal Corps. He was sent to France on May 27, 1918, and was killed in action on October 1, 1918, during the Meuse-Argonne Offensive. File includes letters about his service, a postcard of a picture of Huffman, newspaper clippings, and a card with Huffman's name with a gold star (used to denote the files of individuals who died in the line of duty).
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Field Artillery Regiment, 20th; United States. Army. Signal Corps
Topics: Huffman, Robert Benjamin; Argonne, Battle of the, France, 1918; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: Clifford William Huffmaster
Title: Clifford William Huffmaster file
Description: File documenting the participation of Clifford William Huffmaster in World War I. Huffmaster enlisted on June 21, 1916, and was first stationed at East Hannibal, Illinois, with the 5th Illinois Infantry. He transferred to Quincy, Illinois on August 1, 1917, and later to Camp Logan, Texas, on September 14, 1917. On October 11, 1917, he joined the 124th Machine Gun Battalion. He was hospitalized for nephritis while at Camp Logan until he was medically discharged on January 11, 1918, and had to be hospitalized again for nephritis on November 9, 1918, at U.S. Marine Hospital in St. Louis. He died on May 29, 1923. File includes a survey and RSVP card. Description supplemented by information from Ancestry.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Illinois Infantry Regiment, 5th; United States. Army. Machine Gun Battalion, 124th
Topics: Huffmaster, Clifford William; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: Justin Mendal Hughes
Title: Justin Mendal Hughes file
Description: File documenting the participation of Justin Mendal Hughes in World War I. Hughes enlisted on April 26, 1918, and was stationed at Camp Travis in San Antionio, Texas, with the 360th Infantry. He was sent overseas on June 14, 1918, and participated in the Battle of St. Mihiel and the Muese-Argonne Offensive. On November 2, 1918, he was hospitalized in Paris for a fractured femur. He returned to the states on April 14, 1919, and stayed at U.S. General Hospital #28 at Fort Sheridan, Illinois, until his discharge on February 18, 1920. File includes a survey and address card.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Infantry Regiment, 360th; United States. Army. General Hospital No. 28

He transferred to the 5th Machine Gun Battalion and joined the Central Machine Gun Officers' Training School at Camp Hancock, Georgia. Iler was discharged on December 3. 1918. File includes a survey and letter.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Infantry Regiment, 37th; United States. Army. Machine Gun Battalion, 5th; Central Machine Gun Officers' Training School (Camp Hancock, Ga.)
Topics: Iler, Merle E.; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: Jacob Henry Iles
Title: Jacob Henry Iles file
Description: File documenting the participation of Jacob H. Iles in World War I. Iles served as a corporal with the 52nd Coast Artillery Corps. He left Hoboken, New Jersey, on May 28, 1918, for the front, and returned from Brest, France, on January 14, 1919. File includes a letter asking for his address in October 1918. Description supplemented by information from Fold3.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Coast Artillery Regiment, 52nd
Topics: Iles, Jacob Henry; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: Guy William Ireland
Title: Guy William Ireland file
Description: File documenting the participation of Guy William Ireland in World War I. Ireland enlisted on December 10, 1917, and was first stationed at Kelly Field, Texas, in the Air Service. He joined the Enlisted Mechanics Training Department on May 12, 1918, and in October 1918, he transferred to Chanute Field, Illinois. Ireland was discharged on March 25, 1919. File includes a survey, photo, letters, newspaper clippings, RSVP card, and a booklet of poems entitled ΓÇ£A Few Military PoemsΓÇ¥ by Eber H. Smith who was also at Kelly Field.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Air Service

Name: True Chester Ives
Title: True Chester Ives file
Description: File documenting the participation of True Chester Ives in World War I. Ives enlisted on April 26, 1918, and was first stationed at Camp Dodge, Iowa. He served with the 163rd Depot Brigade, then transferred to the 352nd Infantry, and, on May 5, 1918, he joined the Medical Department. Ives was discharged on February 6, 1919. File includes a service record certificate and newspaper clippings.

Related organization/service branch: United States. War Dept. Quartermaster Corps
Topics: Jackson, Ervin; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: Clifford Douglas Jacobs
Title: Clifford Douglas Jacobs file
Description: File documenting the participation of Clifford Douglas Jacobs in World War I. Jacobs enlisted on August 27, 1917, and first attended Officers' Training Camp at Fort Sheridan, Illinois. On December 15, 1917, he transferred to Camp Greene, North Carolina, to join the 8th Machine Gun Battalion. He was sent overseas on April 2, 1918, and participated in the Battle of Chateau Thierry, the Second Battle of Marne at Champagne and Aisne, the St. Mihiel Offensive, and the Meuse-Argonne Offensive. He returned to the States on August 12, 1919, and was discharged on September 20, 1919. File includes a survey, photo, letters, and a newspaper clipping.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Machine Gun Battalion, 8th
Topics: Jacobs, Clifford Douglas; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: Edmund J. James
Title: Edmund J. James file
Description: File documenting the participation of Edmund J. James in World War I. James was the president of the University of Illinois at the time of his enlistment and served as a Colonel of the Illinois National Guard, due to a law that required the presidents of Illinois educational institutions who have a military department automatically become colonels in the National Guard. He quit his role as president on September 4, 1918, to pursue work with the Red Cross or Y.M.C.A. File includes newspaper clippings and booklet of the January 7, 1918, edition of The War Committee bulletin from the University of Illinois.
Related organization/service branch: Illinois. National Guard
Topics: James, Edmund J. (Edmund Janes), 1855-1925; World War, 1914-1918; University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign--Students

Name: Elmer A. Jensen
Title: Elmer A. Jensen file
Description: File documenting the participation of Elmer A. Jensen in World War I. Jensen enlisted on December 14, 1917, and was first stationed at Chanute Field, Illinois, with the 210th Aero Squadron. He was sent overseas on February 26, 1918, and was stationed in Doncaster, England. He was hospitalized in Liverpool, England, on October 5, 1918, for gastric ulcers, and left England on a hospital ship on December 1, 1918. From there, he stayed at Base Hospital No. 3 in New York until December 22, when he transferred to General Hospital No. 28 at Fort Sheridan, Illinois. He stayed there until he was discharged on February 25, 1919. File includes a survey, photo, letter, newspaper clippings, and an RSVP card.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Air Service; United States. Army. Air Service. Aero Squadron, 210th;
Topics: Jensen, Elmer A.; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students
Genre/format: questionnaires; photographs; letters (correspondence); newspaper clippings; reply cards;

Name: Howard A. Johnson
Title: Howard A. Johnson file
Description: File documenting the participation of Howard A. Johnson in World War I. Johnson enlisted on August 7, 1917, and was stationed in Austin at the University of Texas to join the School of Military Aeronautics. He was sent to France in November 1917, and continued his education at the Chateauroux Air Station, France on April 30, 1918. On August 7, 1918, he transferred to Issodun, France with the Third Aviation Instruction Center. He transferred to the Aerial School in Saint-Jean-de-Monts, France, on October 28, 1918, and joined the 683rd Aero Squadron on November 16, 1918, in Lay St. Remy, France. On January 2, 1919, Johnson crashed his plane and spent the next three months in army hospitals in Issodun, Chateauroux, Savenay, and Brest, France. He returned to the states on March 23, 1919, and received treatment from army hospitals in New York City, then McHenry, Maryland, and Chicago. File includes a survey, address cards, notes from Johnson, letters, newspaper clippings, and an RSVP card.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Air Service; University of Texas; Chateauroux Air Station (Chateauroux, France); Aviation Instruction Center, 3rd (France); Saint-John-de-Monts Aerial Gunnery School (France); United States. Army. Air Service. Aero Squadron, 638th
Topics: Johnson, Howard A., 1893-1974; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students
Genre/format: questionnaires; reply cards; letters (correspondence); newspaper clippings;

He transferred to the Aerial School in Saint-Jean-de-Monts, France, on October 28, 1918, and joined the 683rd Aero Squadron on November 16, 1918, in Lay St. Remy, France. On January 2, 1919, Johnson crashed his plane and spent the next three months in army hospitals in Issodun, Chateauroux, Savenay, and Brest, France. He returned to the states on March 23, 1919, and received treatment from army hospitals in New York City, then McHenry, Maryland, and Chicago. File includes a survey, address cards, notes from Johnson, letters, newspaper clippings, and an RSVP card.

Name: Allington Joyce Jolly
Title: Allington Joyce Jolly file
Description: File documenting the participation of Allington Joyce Jolly in World War I. Jolly enlisted on May 19, 1916, and was first stationed at Fort Bliss, Texas, with the 103rd Coast Artillery Corps. He transferred to the 20th Infantry on October 10, 1916, and to the 16th Infantry on May 20, 1917. He was sent overseas on May 26, 1917, and served with the Headquarters Troops. On November 27, 1917, he joined the Air Service Signal Corps and attended the 2nd Aviation Instruction Center in Tours, France. He returned to the States on March 12, 1919, and was discharged on March 27, 1919. Jolly applied for recommission the same day. While waiting for assignment, he worked for a private aircraft company in New York as a test pilot. The wings of the plane he was testing collapsed and Jolly died on April 27, 1919. File includes a survey, letters, newspaper clippings, and a gold star (used to denote the files of individuals who died in the line of duty). Descriptions supplemented by information from Fold3.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Coast Artillery Regiment, 103rd; United States. Army. Infantry Regiment, 20th; United States. Army. Infantry Regiment, 16th; United States. Army. Headquarters Company; United States. Army. Air Service; United States. Army. Air Service. Signal Corps
Topics: Jolly, Allington Joyce; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students
Genre/format: questionnaires; letters (correspondence); newspaper clippings; cards (information artifacts);

Name: Arthur Bowman Jolly
Title: Arthur Bowman Jolly file
Description: File documenting the participation of Arthur Bowman Jolly in World War I. Jolly enlisted on October 3, 1915, and was stationed at Fort Howard, Maryland, as a gunner in the 140th Coast Artillery Corps. On May 23, 1916, he joined the 103rd Coast Artillery Corps and transferred to Fort Bliss, Texas. On June 19, 1916, he joined the 20th Infantry, and on April 2, 1917, he joined the Quartermasters Corps. He joined the Headquarters Detachment Motor Truck Group as a dispatcher on June 3, 1917. He transferred to Camp Owen Bierne at Fort Bliss, to join the 15th Supply Train, and on February 2, 1919, he joined the Motor Truck Group as a Sergeant Major. Jolly received his commission as a 2nd Lieutenant in the Quartermaster reserves on April 14, 1919. File includes a survey, letters, and newspaper clipping.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Coast Artillery Regiment, 140th; United States. Army. Coast Artillery Regiment, 103rd; United States. Army. Name: Kenneth Hugh Jones
Title: Kenneth Hugh Jones file
Description: File documenting the participation of Kenneth Hugh Jones in World War I. Jones enlisted on May 1, 1917, and was first stationed at Fort Howard, Maryland, with the 3rd Coast Artillery Corps. He transferred to Camp Taylor, Kentucky in November 1917 to join the 309th Field Squadron. In February 1918, he joined the Aviation Signal Corps and attended the School of Military Aeronautics at the University of Illinois. He transferred to Dallas, Texas in April 1918, then Dayton, Ohio, in May 1918, and Chanute Field, Illinois, in August 1918. In September 1918, he became a Lieutenant in San Antonio, Texas. In October 1918, he transferred to Rockwell Field in San Diego, California. Jones was discharged on January 7, 1919. File includes a survey, photos, letters, newspaper clippings, and an RSVP card.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Coast Artillery Regiment, 3rd; United States. Army. Field Squadron, 309th; University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign. School of Military Aeronautics; United States. Army. Air Service; United States. Army. Air Service. Signal Corps
Topics: Jones, Kenneth Hugh; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: Alfred William Kasel
Title: Alfred William Kasel file
Description: File documenting the participation of Alfred William Kasel in World War I. Kasel enlisted on February 26, 1918, and served at Camp Taylor, Kentucky, and Camp Sherman, Ohio, with the 335th Infantry. He was sent to France on September 3, 1918, and was stationed in Mussidan, France. He joined the 26th Infantry to participate in the Meuse Argonne Offensive, and stayed after the armistice in Coblenz, Germany. Kasel returned to the States on August 17, 1919, and was discharged August 26, 1919. File includes a survey.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Infantry Regiment, 335th; United States. Army. Infantry Regiment, 26th (1901-1957)
Topics: Kasel, Alfred William; Argonne, Battle of the, France, 1918; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: Joseph Clarence Keel
Title: Joseph Clarence Keel file
Description: File documenting the participation of Joseph Clarence Keel in World War I. Keel enlisted on July 1, 1918, and was first stationed at the Valparaiso University, Indiana. He transferred to the University of Michigan on August 13, 1918, and later joined the Training School for Telephone Electrician and Radio Operators at the university. He then joined the Students' Army Training Corps until he was discharged on December 10, 1918. File includes a survey.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; Valparaiso University; University of Michigan; United States. Army. Students' Army Training Corps
Topics: Keel, Joseph Clarence; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: Frances Peters Kendrick
Title: Frances Peters Kendrick file
Description: File documenting the participation of Frances Peters Kendrick in World War I. Kendrick joined the Navy Reserves on September 4, 1918. She was stationed in Washington, D.C., in the Correspondence Division of Enlisted Personnel in the Bureau of Navigation. She was released from active duty on July 31, 1919. File includes letters from Kendrick. Additional materials on Frances Peters Kendrick can be found in this collection in the Frances Elizabeth Peters file (Kendrick's maiden name).
Related organization/service branch: United States. Navy; United States. Naval Reserve
Topics: Kendrick, Frances Peters; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: Thomas Hart Kennedy
Title: Thomas Hart Kennedy file
Description: File documenting the participation of Thomas Kart Kennedy in World War I. Kennedy enlisted on July 16, 1918, and was first stationed at Fort Sheridan, Illinois, with the Students' Army Training Corps. On September 16, 1918, he transferred to the Camp Headquarters at the University of Wisconsin. He joined the Infantry Central Officers Training School at Camp Grant, Illinois, on October 10, 1918. He was released from active duty on January 15, 1919, and returned to Normal, Illinois, but remained with the Infantry Reserves. File includes a survey.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Students' Army Training Corps; University of Wisconsin; Infantry Officers Training School (Camp Grant, Ill.); United States. Army. Infantry
Topics: Kennedy, Thomas Hart; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: Grover William Kerr
Title: Grover William Kerr file
Description: File documenting the participation of Grover William Kerr in World War I. Kerr enlisted on August 2, 1917, in the Marine Corps and first served on Paris Island, South Carolina. He transferred to Quantico, Virginia, to join the 119th Replacement Battalion. He left for France on February 6, 1918, and joined the 6th Marine Regiment. He participated in the Battles of Verdun, Chateau-Thierry, St. Mihiel, and Soissons, and the engagements in Pont-A-Mousson, Belleau Wood, and Meuse-Argonne Offensive. He was wounded in battle three times and was hospitalized at Base Hospital no. 51 in Toul, France, Base Hospital no. 33 in Neafchateau, France, and Base Hospital no. 27 in Angers, France. Kerr remained in Rhenbohl, Germany, after the war, and later began teaching at the American Expeditionary Forces University in Beaune, France. He returned to the States in September 1919. File includes a survey, address card, letters, and newspaper clippings.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Marine Corps; United States. Marine Corps. Marine Regiment, 6th; American Expeditionary Forces University (Beaune, France)
Topics: Kerr, Grover William; Verdun, Battle of, Verdun, France, 1916; Ch├óteau-Thierry, Battle of, Ch├óteau-Thierry, France, 1918; Saint-Mihiel, Battle of, Saint-Mihiel, France, 1918; Soissons, Battle of, Soissons, France, 1918; Belleau Wood, Battle of, France, 1918; Argonne, Battle of the, France, 1918; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: Grover William Kerr
Title: Grover William Kerr file
Description: File documenting the participation of Grover William Kerr in World War I. Kerr enlisted on August 2, 1917, in the Marine Corps and first served on Paris Island, South Carolina. He transferred to Quantico, Virginia, to join the 119th Replacement Battalion. He left for France on February 6, 1918, and joined the 6th Marine Regiment. He participated in the Battles of Verdun, Chateau-Thierry, St. Mihiel, and Soissons, and the engagements in Pont-A-Mousson, Belleau Wood, and Meuse-Argonne Offensive. He was wounded in battle three times and was hospitalized at Base Hospital no. 51 in Toul, France, Base Hospital no. 33 in Neafchateau, France, and Base Hospital no. 27 in Angers, France. Kerr remained in Rhenbohl, Germany, after the war, and later began teaching at the American Expeditionary Forces University in Beaune, France. He returned to the States in September 1919. File includes a survey, address card, letters, and newspaper clippings.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Marine Corps; United States. Marine Corps. Marine Regiment, 6th; American Expeditionary Forces University (Beaune, France)

Name: Herbert Thomas Kerr
Title: Herbert Thomas Kerr file
Description: File documenting the participation of Herbert Thomas Kerr in World War I. Kerr enlisted on February 23, 1918, and first served at Camp Grant, Illinois, with the 343rd Infantry. He transferred to Camp Dix, New Jersey, on April 10, 1918, to join the 53rd Engineers. He was sent to France on June 19, 1918, and joined the 24th Transportation Corps in Gievres, France, on March 24, 1919. He transferred to the American Expeditionary Forces University in Beaune, France, on April 15, 1919, to work in the Headquarters. He returned to the states on July 2, 1919, and was discharged on July 10, 1919. File includes a survey, address card, service record card, letters, and newspaper clippings.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Infantry Regiment, 343rd; United States. Army. Field Artillery Regiment, 53rd; United States. Army. Transportation Corps. Company, 24th; American Expeditionary Forces University (Beaune, France)
Topics: Kerr, Herbert Thomas; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: John Henry Ketring
Title: John Henry Ketring file
Description: File documenting the participation of John Henry Ketring in World War I. Ketring enlisted on September 5, 1918, and first served at Camp Forrest, Georgia with the 11th Engineers. He left Hoboken, New Jersey, for France on October 27, 1918, and on December 3, 1918, he joined the 303rd Engineers. Ketring returned from St. Nazaire, France, on July 25, 1919, and was discharged July 31, 1919. File includes letters. Description supplemented by information from Fold3.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Engineer Regiment, 11th; United States. Army. Engineer Regiment, 303rd
Topics: Ketring, John Henry; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: William Howard Ketring
Title: William Howard Ketring file
Description: File documenting the participation of William Howard Ketring in World War I. Ketring enlisted on September 5, 1918, and first served with the 116th Engineers. He left Hoboken, New Jersey, on October 27, 1918, and transferred to the 303rd Engineers on December 3, 1918. In April 1919, he attended the Université de Montpellier in Herault, France. Ketring returned to the States from St. Nazaire, France, on July 23, 1919, and was discharged on July 31, 1919. File includes a letter and newspaper clippings. Title: Raymond Mason Kettering file
Description: File documenting the participation of Raymond Mason Kettering in World War I. Kettering enlisted in September 1917, and first served in Camp Pike, Arkansas, in the Infantry. Name: George L. Kiefer
Title: George L. Kiefer file
Description: File documenting the participation of George L. Kiefer in World War I. Keifer enlisted on May 20, 1918, and was stationed at Eagle Pass, Texas, with the 3rd Infantry. He developed a bone infection and was hospitalized from November 25, 1918, until his discharge on April 28, 1920. During that time, he was at camp hospitals in Eagle Pass, Texas, Corpus Christie, Texas, Camp Travis, Texas, Camp Grant, Illinois, and Fort Sheridan, Illinois. After the armistice was signed, Kiefer stayed at Fort Sheridan for vocational training. File includes a survey.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Infantry Regiment, 3rd
Topics: Kiefer, George L.; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Title: Lawrence E. Kincaid file

Name: Chester E. King
Title: Chester E. King file
Description: File documenting the participation of Chester E. King in World War I. King enlisted on April 10, 1918, and first served in Peoria, Illinois, with the Bradley Polytechnic Training Unit. On June 22, 1918, he transferred to Augusta, Georgia, to join the 36th Provisional Ordnance Company. He was sent to Brest, France, on July 31, 1918, and returned on April 12, 1919. King was discharged on May 2, 1919. File includes a survey and letter.

Name: Gay Andrew Kinter
Title: Gay Andrew Kinter file
Description: File documenting the participation of Gay Andrew Kinter in World War I. Kinter enlisted on September 20, 1917, and first served at Camp Dodge, Iowa, with the 349th Infantry. On November 19, 1918, he transferred to Camp Pike, Arkansas, to join the 346th Infantry. He transferred to the 38th Infantry on April 21, 1918, at Camp Greene, North Carolina. He was sent overseas on July 25, 1918, and participated in the offensives at Somme, St. Mihiel, Vesle, and Meuse-Argonne. After the war, he was stationed in Muden and Trier in Germany, and later in Esch Luxemburg. On June 9, 1919, he was sent to Calais, France. Kinter returned to the States on August 1, 1918, and was discharged on August 8, 1919. File includes a survey.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Infantry Regiment, 349th; United States. Army. Infantry Regiment, 346th; United States. Army. Infantry Regiment, 38th (1917-1957)
Topics: Kinter, Gay Andrew; Somme, 2nd Battle of the, France, 1918; Saint-Mihiel, Battle of, Saint-Mihiel, France, 1918; Argonne, Battle of the, France, 1918; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: Gay Andrew Kinter
Title: Gay Andrew Kinter file
Description: File documenting the participation of Gay Andrew Kinter in World War I. Kinter enlisted on September 20, 1917, and first served at Camp Dodge, Iowa, with the 349th Infantry. On November 19, 1918, he transferred to Camp Pike, Arkansas, to join the 346th Infantry. He transferred to the 38th Infantry on April 21, 1918, at Camp Greene, North Carolina. He was sent overseas on July 25, 1918, and participated in the offensives at Somme, St. Mihiel, Vesle, and Meuse-Argonne. After the war, he was stationed in Muden and Trier in Germany, and later in Esch Luxemburg. On June 9, 1919, he was sent to Calais, France. Kinter returned to the States on August 1, 1918, and was discharged on August 8, 1919. File includes a survey.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Infantry Regiment, 349th; United States. Army. Infantry Regiment, 346th; United States. Army. Infantry Regiment, 38th (1917-1957)
Topics: Kinter, Gay Andrew; Somme, 2nd Battle of the, France, 1918; Saint-Mihiel, Battle of, Saint-Mihiel, France, 1918; Argonne, Battle of the, France, 1918; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: Julius Philip Klemm
Title: Julius Philip Klemm file
Description: File documenting the participationolf Julius Philip Klemm in World War I. Klemm enlisted on June 6, 1917, and first served at Camp Logan, Texas, with the 124th Ordnance Department. He transferred to the Central Machine Gun Officers Training School at Camp Hancock, Georgia, on November 26, 1918. He was hospitalized briefly for influenza. Klemm was discharged in December 1918. File includes a survey and newspaper clippings.

Name: Freeman Albert Koehler
Title: Freeman Albert Koehler file
Description: File documenting the participation of Freeman Albert Koehler in World War I. Koehler enlisted on May 28, 1917, and was first stationed at Camp Gordon in the 6th Replacement Regiment Band. He was sent overseas with the 62nd July Automatic Replacement Regiment on July 12, 1918. On September 10, 1918, he joined the Headquarters Company band at the American Post Office 762. He joined the Supply Company for the APO 762 on November 5, 1918. On February 21, 1919, he joined the Postal Detachment for the same Post Office in Le Mans, France. On March 21, 1919, he was student at the American Expeditionary Forces University in Beaune, France. He returned to the States in July 1919. File includes a survey and newspaper clipping.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Supply Company; United States. Army. Postal Service; American Expeditionary Forces University (Beaune, France)
Topics: Koehler, Freeman Albert; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: Ralph G. Lacey
Title: Ralph G. Lacey file
Description: File documenting the participation of Ralph G. Lacey in World War I. Lacey enlisted in the 117th Signal Battalion and was stationed at Camp Lewis, Washington. He was sent to San Diego, California, before leaving for France on August 7, 1918, with the 145th Machine Gun Battalion. He rejoined the 117th Signal Battalion and was stationed at La Havre, France. He was sent to St. Aignan, France, and participated in the Meuse-Argonne Offensive. After the armistice was signed, he was sent to Neuenahr, Germany. Lacey returned to the States on April 15, 1919. File includes an address card and newspaper clipping. Description supplemented by information from Fold3.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Field Signal Battalion, 117th; United States. Army. Machine Gun Battalion, 145th
Topics: Lacey, Ralph G.; Argonne, Battle of the, France, 1918; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: Howard Scott Lanterman
Title: Howard Scott Lanterman file
Description: File documenting the participation of Howard Scott Lanterman in World War I. Lanterman registered for enlistment on June 5, 1917. He was stationed at Camp Gordon, Georgia, with the 3rd Infantry Replacement Regiment. He was sent overseas with the 28th Infantry on July 22, 1918. On October 4, 1918, he was injured during the Meuse-Argonne Offensive, and was sent back to the States on January 19, 1919. He was sent to Camp Grant Base Hospital. File includes letters and newspaper clippings. Description supplemented by information from Fold3.

Name: Levi Lathrop
Title: Levi Lathrop file
Description: File documenting the participation of Levi Lathrop in World War I. Lathrop enlisted on June 26, 1918, and was stationed at Camp Zachary Taylor in Kentucky. He started in the 159th Depot Brigade and transferred to the Field Artillery Central Officers Training School in July 1918. He joined the 19th Observational Battery while waiting for his commission. He was discharged on December 16, 1918. He died on June 26, 1918, from being struck by lightning during a camping trip. File includes a photo, letters, newspaper clippings, and a copy of v. 1, no. 5 (October 16, 1918) of The Probable Error, a newspaper published by the Field Artillery Central Officers Training School at Camp Zachary Taylor.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Depot Brigade, 159th; Field Artillery Central Officers Training School (Camp Zachary Taylor, Ky.); United States. Army. Observation Battery, 19th

He was sent overseas with the 322nd Machine Gun Battalion on July 23, 1918, and participated in the Meuse Argonne Offensive in October 1918. Title: Dexter Allen Legg file
Description: File documenting the participation of Dexter Allen Legg in World War I. Legg enlisted on May 28, 1918, and was first stationed at Camp Gordon, Georgia, with the 6th Replacement Regiment. He transferred to Camp Merritt, New Jersey, to join the 63rd Field Artillery. He was sent overseas with the 322nd Machine Gun Battalion on July 23, 1918, and participated in the Meuse Argonne Offensive in October 1918. After the Armistice was signed, he was stationed in Fresnes, France, with the 116th Machine Gun Battalion. Legg returned to the States on May 24, 1920, and was discharged June 2, 1920. File includes a survey and photo.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Replacement Regiment, 6th; United States. Army. Field Artillery Regiment, 63rd; United States. Army. Machine Gun Battalion, 322nd; United States. Army. Machine Gun Battalion, 116th
Topics: Legg, Dexter Allen; Argonne, Battle of the, France, 1918; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: Jesse D. Lester
Title: Jesse D. Lester file
Description: File documenting the participation of Jesse D. Lester in World War I. Lester enlisted on May 25, 1918, and was stationed with the 151st Field Hospital at Camp Shelby, Mississippi. He left for Europe on October 6, 1918, and was stationed at Selles Sur Cher, France, with the Infirmary of the 31st Replacement Depot on December 1, 1918. He was hospitalized in Manchester, England, for the flu and later pneumonia on October 17, 1918. On April 1, 1919, he transferred to the Disability Board at St. Aignan, France. He joined the St. Aignon Casual Company on June 1, 1919, and returned to the States on June 20, 1919. Lester was discharged on July 10, 1919. File includes a survey, letter, and RSVP card. Description supplemented by information from Fold3.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Field Hospital, 151st; United States. Army. Replacement Depot, 1st
Topics: Lester, Jesse D.; Influenza Epidemic, 1918-1919; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: William Glenn Lewis
Title: William Glenn Lewis file
Description: File documenting the participation of William Glenn Lewis in World War I. Lewis enlisted on June 28, 1918, and was first stationed at Camp Wheeler, Georgia with the Headquarters Company in the 121st Infantry. He transferred to Camp Merritt, New Jersey, in September 1918, and was meant to go overseas, but he caught the flu and was hospitalized at Embarkation Hospital #2. Once released from the hospital, he served in the personnel office at Camp Merritt, New Jersey, until his discharge on June 7, 1919. File includes a survey and RSVP card.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Infantry Regiment, 121st; United States. Army. Headquarters Company
Topics: Lewis, William Glenn; Influenza Epidemic, 1918-1919; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: Charles Chesterfield Liggitt
Title: Charles Chesterfield Liggitt file
Description: File documenting the participation of Charles Chesterfield Liggitt in World War I. Liggitt enlisted on December 10, 1917. He was first stationed at Municipal Pier in Chicago, and transferred to Cleveland, Ohio, on May 24, 1918. He returned to Chicago and was hospitalized for measles in September 1918. He transferred to Pelham Bay Naval Training Station in New York and was ordered to San Francisco on December 31, 1918. Liggitt was sent back to Pelham Bay and was discharged on March 6, 1919. File includes a survey, address card, and newspaper clippings.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Navy; United States. Naval Reserve
Topics: Liggitt, Charles Chesterfield; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students; University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign--Students; University High School (Normal, Ill.)--Students

Name: Ralph Harlan Linkins
Title: Ralph Harlan Linkins file
Description: File documenting the participation of Ralph Harlan Linkins in World War I. Linkins enlisted on June 27, 1918, and was first stationed at Camp Wheeler, Georgia, with the Medical Department 106th Armored Train. He went to Yale Army Lab School in Connecticut on September 17, 1918, first as a student and later as a teacher. On February 15, 1919, he transferred to Newport News, Virginia, to work in their Port Laboratory. Linkins was discharged on March 21, 1919. File includes a survey, photo, letter, and newspaper clippings.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Medical Department; United States. Army. Armored Train, 106th; Yale University
Topics: Linkins, Ralph Harlan; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Faculty; University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign--Students

Name: John Little
Title: John Little file
Description: File documenting the participation of John Little in World War I. Little enlisted on May 25, 1917, and was first stationed with the Infantry Recruiting Services in Peoria, Illinois. He transferred to Bloomington, Illinois, on October 1, 1917, and then to Decatur, Illinois, on July 20, 1918. On September 12, 1918, he was sent to Jefferson Barracks, Missouri, and was hospitalized for the flu on October 10, 1918. He was transferred to Camp Bowie, Texas on November 6, 1918. Little was discharged in March 1919.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Recruiting Service
Topics: Little, John; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: Sam A. Livingston
Location: Great Lakes Naval Training Center (Great Lakes, Ill.)
Title: Sam A. Livingston file
Description: File documenting the participation of Sam A. Livingston in World War I. Livingston enlisted on May 15, 1918, and served with the Navy Reserves Medical Department at the Great Lakes Naval Training Station in Illinois. He was stationed on the U.S.S. North Dakota, and he transferred to Hampton Roads, Virginia, in June 1919 to join the U.S.S. General Goethals. He became a pharmacist's mate at a Brooklyn hospital until his discharge on September 29, 1919. File includes a survey and newspaper clippings.

Name: Charles Richard Loney
Title: Charles Richard Loney file
Description: File documenting the participation of Charles Richard Loney in World War I. Loney was accepted for enlistment on May 4, 1917, but was called for training on September 8, 1917, with the 10th Illinois Infantry in Springfield, Illinois. He was sent to Chicago on December 15, 1917, to join the Signal Enlisted Reserve Corp. On November 1, 1918, he joined the Air Service at Scott Field, Illinois. When the airfield closed on March 15, 1919, he transferred to Barron Field at Camp Travis, Texas, as a flying instructor in the 35th Infantry. File includes a survey, letters, and a newspaper clipping.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Illinois Infantry Regiment, 10th; United States. Army. Signal Enlisted Reserve Corps; United States. Army. Air Service; United States. Army. Infantry Regiment, 35th
Topics: Loney, Charles Richard; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: William Neil Loudon
Title: William Neil Loudon file
Description: File documenting the participation of William Neil Loudon in World War I. Loudon enlisted on December 31, 1917, and served in the Motor Transport Corps at Camp Johnston, Florida. He began making several trips east from Lima, Ohio, Alma, Michigan, Allentown, Pennsylvania, or Detroit to ports of embarkation in New York City, Philadelphia, and Baltimore. He was scheduled to go overseas in November 1918, but the armistice was signed just days prior, so he did not go. Loudon was discharged on February 12, 1919. File includes a survey, letter, and RSVP card.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Motor Transport Corps
Topics: Loudon, William Neil; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: Charles L. Low
Title: Charles L. Low file
Description: File includes a letter documenting the participation of Charles L. Low in World War I. Low enlisted on May 7, 1917, and served as a pharmacist's mate in the Navy Hospital Corps on the U.S.S. Rhode Island which was based out of Hampton Roads, Virginia. Description supplemented with information from the Naval History and Heritage Command.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Navy; United States. Navy. Hospital Corps
Topics: Low, Charles L.; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: Russel Leon Lowe
Title: Russel Leon Lowe file
Description: File documenting the participation of Russel Leon Lowe in World War I. Lowe enlisted on July 19, 1917, and first served with the 130th Infantry in Newton, Illinois. He transferred to Camp Logan, Texas, on November 10, 1917, and became a bugler for the 130th Infantry Band. He left for France in April 1918 and was stationed in Albert, France. He served in the Battle of Hamel, Somme Defensive, and the Meuse-Argonne Battle. He was hospitalized for influenza in October 1918 at Glorieux, near Verdun, France. After the armistice was signed, he was stationed in Oberbillig, Germany, and Betterdorf, Luxembourg. Lowe returned to the States on May 22, 1919, and was discharged on May 31, 1919. File includes a survey and letters.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Infantry Regiment, 130th (1917-1959)
Topics: Lowe, Russel Leon; Bands (Music); Le Hamel, Battle of, Le Hamel, Amiens, France, 1918; Somme, 2nd Battle of the, France, 1918; Argonne, Battle of the, France, 1918; Influenza Epidemic, 1918-1919; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: Scott Wike Lucas
Title: Scott Wike Lucas file
Description: File documenting the participation of Scott Wike Lucas in World War I. Lucas enlisted on April 5, 1918, and first served at Fort Screven, Georgia, in the 7th Coast Artillery Corps. He joined the 3rd Coast Artillery Corps on May 5, 1918. On October 5, 1918, he was transferred to Fort Monroe, Virginia. He was discharged from active duty on December 16, 1920, but remained in the army reserves for five years. File includes a survey and a newspaper clipping of his law office.

Name: David B. Lutz
Title: David B. Lutz file
Description: File documenting the participation of David B. Lutz in World War I. Lutz was called to training in the Air Service on November 20, 1917. He attended Aviation Ground School at the University of Illinois. He transferred to Camp Dick, Texas, and joined the Flying Squadron #2 in February 1918. In October 1918, he was sent to Langley Field in Virginia for coast patron duty. Lutz was discharged in January 1919. File includes a photo, postcards, letter, and newspaper clippings.

Name: Franklin Harold Lutz
Title: Franklin Harold Lutz file
Description: File documenting the participation of Franklin Harold Lutz in World War I. Lutz enlisted on April 11, 1917. He was first stationed at Fort Monroe, Virginia, with the 6th Coast Artillery. In September 1917, he transferred to Camp Taylor, Kentucky, to join the 333rd Infantry. He joined the 680th Aero Squadron in January 1918 at Kelly Field in Texas. He was sent overseas on July 31, 1918, with the 307th Aero Squadron, and was stationed in Grantham, England. Lutz returned to the States on December 1, 1918, and was discharged December 28, 1918. File includes a survey, photos, a postcard, letters, newspaper clippings, and an RSVP card. Description supplemented by information from Fold3.

Name: Cecil Wengert Macy
Title: Cecil Wengert Macy file
Description: File documenting the participation of Cecil Wengert Macy in World War I. Macy enlisted on March 11, 1918, and first served in Rochester, New York, at the School of Aerial Photography. He transferred to Fort Sill, Oklahoma, to join the Photo Detachment. On September 1, 1918, he transferred to Austin, Texas, to join the University of Texas School for Radio Operators. He then transferred to Columbia University to join the School for Radio Officers on November 1, 1918. Macy was discharged from active duty on February 7, 1919, and joined the Air Service Reserve Corps. File includes a survey, photo, letters, newspaper clippings, and an RSVP card.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Air Service; University of Rochester; University of Texas; Columbia University

Name: Paul H. Martin
Title: Paul H. Martin file
Description: File documenting the participation of Paul H. Martin in World War I. Martin enlisted on May 1, 1917, and was first stationed at Fort Riley, Kansas, in the medical department of the 26th Infantry. He was sent overseas in September 1917, and participated in the Battle at Chateau-Thierry and the Meuse-Argonne Offensive. He returned to the States on March 26, 1919, and was briefly hospitalized for an injury received while on the front lines. Martin was discharged on August 22, 1919. File includes newspaper clippings and an RSVP card. Description supplemented with information from Fold3
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Infantry Regiment, 26th (1901-1957); United States. Army. Medical Department; United States. Army. Infantry Regiment, 340th

Name: Elizabeth I. Matheny
Title: Elizabeth I. Matheny file
Description: File documenting the participation of Elizabeth I. Matheny in World War I. Matheny entered the service in August 1918 and was stationed overseas with the Y.M.C.A. working at the canteen and cafeteria at the Y.M.C.A. hut in St. Nazaire, France. She returned to the States on August 4, 1919, and left the service on August 16, 1919. File includes a survey, Matheny's service record card, photos, and a letter. Description supplemented by information from Fold3.
Related organization/service branch: YMCA of the USA
Topics: Matheny, Elizabeth I.; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: William Ralph Matthew
Title: William Ralph Matthew file
Description: File documenting the participation of William R. Matthew in World War I. Matthew enlisted on May 1, 1917, and trained at Jefferson Barracks, Missouri with the 52nd Coast Artillery Corps. He was sent overseas on August 13, 1917. He left Brest, France, for the States on January 26, 1919, with the 44th Coast Artillery Corps and was discharged February 25, 1919. File includes photos, letters, newspaper clippings, and a detailed report on Battery F of the 44th Coast Artillery Corps. Description supplemented by information from Fold3.

Name: Roy Milton McCollom
Title: Roy Milton McCollom file
Description: File documenting the participation of Roy Milton McCollom in World War I. McCollom enlisted on September 4, 1917, and was first stationed at Camp Taylor, Kentucky, with the 327th Field Artillery. He transferred to the Field Artillery Central Officers Training School on July 12, 1918. He was assigned to the 7th Field Artillery and transferred to Camp Jackson, South Carolina, in October 1918. He transferred to Camp Sheridan, Alabama, on November 4, 1918, and joined the 85th Field Artillery. McCollom was discharged on December 1, 1918. File includes two copies of his survey and a note documenting his service.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Field Artillery Regiment, 327th; Field Artillery Central Officers Training School (Camp Zachary Taylor, Ky.); United States. Army. Field Artillery Regiment, 7th; United States. Army. Field Artillery Regiment, 85th
Topics: MCCollom, Roy Milton; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: Will Johnson McFarland
Title: Will Johnson McFarland file
Description: File documenting the participation of Will Johnson McFarland in World War I. McFarland enlisted on September 1, 1917, and trained at Fort Sheridan, Illinois, in the Reserve Officer's Training Corps. On December 5, 1917, he transferred to Louisville, Kentucky, to join the 335th Infantry. He arrived overseas on September 8, 1918, and was stationed in the General Headquarters in France until he left St. Nazaire, France, for the States on June 1, 1919. McFarland was discharged on June 28, 1919. File includes a survey, postcards, letters, and newspaper clippings.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Reserve Officers' Training Corps; United States. Army. Infantry Regiment, 335th
Topics: McFarland, Will Johnson; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: Lawrence McIntyre
Title: Lawrence McIntyre file
Description: File includes a survey documenting the participation of Lawrence McIntyre in World War I. McIntyre enlisted on May 28, 1918, and was stationed with the 151st Field Hospital at Camp Shelby, Mississippi. He was sent overseas on October 6, 1918, and was stationed in Poitiers, France, with the Base Hospital no. 218. He worked on the Hsopital Train no. 67 in Savenay, France, after the war ended but was not permanently assigned. McIntyre returned to the States on June 26, 1919, and was discharged on July 2, 1919.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Field Hospital, 151st; United States. Army. Base Hospital No. 218
Topics: McIntyre, Lawrence; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: Chester McLaren
Title: Chester McLaren file
Description: File documenting the participation of Chester McLaren in World War I. McLaren was stationed in Peoria, Illinois, and Camp Logan, Texas, with the 123rd Machine Gun Battalion before he was sent overseas in May 1918. He joined the 33rd Machine Gun Battalion while overseas. He participated in the Meuse-Argonne Offensive and the Battle of St. Mihiel. When the armistice was signed, he was attending officers' training school Le Mans, France, where he stayed until he was sent home. McLaren was discharged in August 1919. File includes a photo and newspaper clippings.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Machine Gun Battalion, 123rd; United States. Army. Machine Gun Battalion, 33rd
Topics: McLaren, Chester; Argonne, Battle of the, France, 1918; Saint-Mihiel, Battle of, Saint-Mihiel, France, 1918; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Machine Gun Battalion, 123rd; United States. Army. Machine Gun Battalion, 33rd

Name: Edward G. McMahon
Title: Edward G. McMahon file
Description: File includes a newspaper clipping of a letter from Edward G. McMahon regarding his World War I service flag for the University. McMahon was stationed at Camp Dodge, Iowa, with the 49th Infantry in April 1918.

Name: Rolf Leo McManus
Title: Rolf Leo McManus file
Description: File includes a letter from the ISNU Alumni Association about the death of Rolf Leo McManus while serving overseas in World War I. McManus was sent to England on October 8, 1918, with the 113th Sanitary Train and became ill with influenza during the trip over. He was immediately hospitalized in Manchester, England, and passed away on October 20, 1918. McManus's remains returned to the states on September 18, 1920. File includes a card with McManus's name with a gold star (used to denote the files of individuals who died in the line of duty). Description supplemented with information from Fold3.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Sanitary Train, 113th
Topics: McManus, Rolf Leo; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: Francis C. McMurry
Title: Francis C. McMurry file
Description: File documenting the participation of Francis C. McMurry in World War I. McMurry served as a fireman in the Navy and was stationed at Hampton Roads Naval Base, Virginia, and Bayonne, New Jersey. He was then on transport service on the ship Philippines until he was discharged in October 1919. File includes newspaper clippings and an RSVP card.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Navy
Topics: McMurry, Francis C.; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: James Willis McMurry
Title: James Willis McMurry file
Description: File documenting the participation of James Willis McMurry in World War I. McMurry enlisted in December 1917 and spent his first few weeks of his service sick with scarlet fever at Jefferson Barracks, Missouri. He was sent to France on February 19, 1918, with the Medical Department. He was stationed in St. Nazaire, France, with Camp Hospital no. 1. McMurry was discharged in June 1919. File includes newspaper clippings. Description supplemented with information from Fold3.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Medical Department; United States. Army. Camp Hospital, 1 (Saint-Nazaire, France)

Name: Asa Guy McReynolds
Title: Asa Guy McReynolds file
Description: File documenting the participation of Asa Guy McReynolds in World War I. McReynolds enlisted on June 10, 1918, and was first stationed in Portland, Maine, with the 73rd Coast Artillery Corps. He was sent overseas on September 25, 1918, and arrived in Liverpool, England, on October 6, 1918. He transferred to France on October 13, 1919, and left out of Brest, France. McReynolds was discharged on January 15, 1919. File includes a survey, letter, photo, and newspaper clipping.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Coast Artillery Regiment, 73rd
Topics: McReynolds, Asa Guy; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: Clarence Glenn McTaggart
Title: Clarence Glenn McTaggart file
Description: File documenting the participation of Clarence Glenn McTaggart in World War I. McTaggart enlisted on May 19, 1917, and trained at the Marine Corps Recruit Depot on Parris Island, South Carolina. He transferred to Quantico, Virginia, on August 18, 1917, and arrived at St. Nazaire, France, on October 6, 1918. He transferred to Brest, France, on November 3, 1917, then to Vosges, France, on January 23, 1918, for training. He was in the Verdun Sector from March 17 to May 11, 1918. He participated in the Battles of Chateau-Thierry, Belleau Woods, St. Mihiel, Blanc Mont Ridge in Champagne, and the Muese-Argonne Offensive. He was injured during the battles of Chateau-Thierry and Belleau Woods and was hospitalized in Vichy, France, from July 15 to August 4, 1918. After the armistice was signed, he was stationed at Niederhammerstein and H├╢nningen, Germany. File includes a survey, photos, letters, newspaper clippings, and an RSVP card.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Marine Corps; United States. Marine Corps. Marine Regiment, 6th
Topics: McTaggart, Clarence Glenn; Ch├óteau-Thierry, Battle of, Ch├óteau-Thierry, France, 1918; Belleau Wood, Battle of, France, 1918; Saint-Mihiel, Battle of, Saint-Mihiel, France, 1918; Blanc Mont Ridge, Battle of, France, 1918; Argonne, Battle of the, France, 1918; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students; University High School (Normal, Ill.)--Faculty
Genre/format: questionnaires; photographs; letters (correspondence); newspaper clippings; reply cards;

Name: William Werse Meyer
Title: William Werse Meyer file
Description: File documenting the participation of William Werse Meyer in World War I. Meyer was drafted on October 3, 1917, and was first stationed at Camp Taylor, Kentucky, with the 327th Field Artillery. Name: George Edward Miller
Title: George Edward Miller file
Description: File documenting the participation of George Edward Miller in World War I. Miller served with the Marines and was stationed as a gun trainer on the U.S.S. San Diego when it sunk. He was transferred to U.S.S. Idaho and the Marine Barracks in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania after surviving the wreck. He was hospitalized for the flu in December 1918. Name: Perl Hobart Miller
Title: Perl Hobart Miller file
Description: File documenting the participation of Perl Hobart Miller in World War I. Miller enlisted on February 22, 1918, and was stationed at Camp Taylor, Kentucky, first with the 159th Depot Brigade. He transferred to the 335th Infantry on April 10, 1918. On April 25, 1918, he joined the 309th Engineers. He was hospitalized from May 15 to July 13, 1918, for overwork. He was then sent to the Plattsburgh Barracks hospital where he stayed until his discharge on October 8, 1918. File includes a survey and newspaper clippings.

Name: Harley Porter Milstead
Title: Harley Porter Milstead file
Description: File documenting the participatoin of Harley Porter Milstead in World War I. Milstead enlisted on July 9, 1917, and was first stationed at the Naval Station in Norfolk, Virginia. He transferred to Philadelphia Naval Yard on February 1, 1918, and left for Europe on March 22, 1918. He joined the U.S.S. Birmingham as a pharmacists' mate in the Medical Corps and travelled from Plymouth, England, Gibraltar, Spain, and Brest, France. He also travelled along the Mediterranean and Adriatic Seas. Milstead returned to the States on February 8, 1919, and was discharged February 27, 1919. File includes a survey, photos, postcards, a letter, newspaper clippings, and an RSVP card.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Navy; Philadelphia Naval Shipyard (Philadelphia, Pa.); United States. Navy. Medical Department
Topics: Milstead, Harley Porter; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: Byron Russell Moore
Location: Great Lakes Naval Training Center (Great Lakes, Ill.)
Title: Byron Russell Moore file
Description: File documenting the participation of Byron Russell Moore in World War I. Moore enlisted on January 18, 1918, and was stationed at the Great Lakes Naval Training Center in Illinois with the Naval Reserve Force as a radio electrician. He transferred to Pelham Bay Naval Training Station in New York on March 15, 1918, then the U.S. Submarine Base in Connecticut on April 7, 1918. He was assigned the U.S.S. Perry and stationed at Plymouth, England, from October 16, 1918, until his return to the States on October 31, 1918. He was on the U.S. Sub-Chaser #104 until January 22, 1919, and was discharged January 23, 1919. File includes a survey, photos, a letter, Moore's service record, newspaper clippings, and an RSVP card.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Navy; United States. Naval Reserve; United States. Naval Radio Service

Name: Mabel L. Morgan
Title: Mabel L. Morgan file
Description: File documenting the participation of Mabel L. Morgan in World War I. Morgan volunteered on November 3, 1917, in the Army Nurse Corps and received training at Camp Grant, Illinois. She transferred to Fort Sill, Oklahoma, on January 26, 1918. On November 9, 1918, she was sent to Hoboken, New Jersey, where she was prepared to leave for France with Base Hospital #90, but the armistice was signed. She stayed at a hospital in the area until April 13, 1919. File includes a Morgan's service record card, letters, and an RSVP card.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army Nurse Corps
Topics: Morgan, Mabel L.; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: John O. Morrissey
Title: John O. Morrissey file
Description: File documenting the participation of John O. Morrissey in World War I. He was first stationed at Camp Meade, Maryland, in the Ambulance Service. By May 1918, he was transferred to Allentown, Pennsylvania. He was sent overseas on June 13, 1918, and was primarily stationed in Italy. After the armistice was signed, he was stationed in Fiume, Italy (modern-day Rijeka, Coatia). He left Genoa, Italy, for the States on April 7, 1919. File includes newspaper clippings. Description supplemented by information from Fold3.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Medical Department; United States. Army. Ambulance Service
Topics: Morrissey, John O.; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Description: File documenting the participation of Emil A. Mueller in World War I. Mueller entered the service in December 1917 and received training at Jefferson Barracks, Missouri. He was sent overseas on May 8, 1918, with Motor Truck Company #423 and returned to the States from St. Nazaire, France, on June 28, 1919. File includes a newspaper clipping and an RSVP card. Description supplemented by information from Fold3.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Motor Truck Company, 423rd
Topics: Mueller, Emil A.; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: Eleazer Rolston Munsell
Location: Great Lakes Naval Training Center (Great Lakes, Ill.)
Title: Eleazer Rolston Munsell file
Description: File documenting the participation of Eleazer Rolston Munsell in World War I. Munsell enlisted in the Navy on December 14, 1917, and was stationed at the Great Lakes Naval Training Station in Illinois for training. On May 5, 1918, he was transferred to Algiers Naval Station in New Orleans and was sent to Coco Solo at the Panama Canal on June 30, 1918. He served as a torpedo gunner on the U.S. Submarine C.2. File includes a letter and newspaper clippings.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army
Topics: Munsell, Eleazer Rolston; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students; Bloomington High School (Bloomington, Ill.)--Students
