Name: Richard Herman Muskopf
Title: Richard Herman Muskopf file
Description: File documenting the participation of Richard Herman Muskopf in World War I. Muskopf enlisted on April 29, 1918, and first served with the 153rd Depot Brigade at Camp Dix, New Jersey. He joined the Medical Department in June 1918. He was sent overseas with the 133rd Infantry in September 1918 and stationed in Le Mans, France. He joined the 310th Infantry in December 1918 in Semur-en-Auxois, France. After the war, in February 1919, Muskopf joined the Graves Registration Service. He left France on September 4, 1919, and was discharged September 24, 1919. File includes a survey and photo. Description supplemented by information from Fold3.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Depot Brigade, 153rd ; United States. Army. Medical Department; United States. Army. Infantry Regiment, 133rd; United States. Army. Infantry Regiment, 310th
Topics: Muskopf, Richard Herman; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: Harry Lee Myers
Title: Harry Lee Myers file
Description: File documenting the participation of Harry Lee Myers in World War I. Myers enlisted on July 25, 1917, and first served at Camp Devens, Massachusetts, with the 25th Engineers. He transferred to Lakewood, New Jersey on November 1, 1918, and later to Fort Sheridan, Illinois, on January 9, 1919. He finished his service at Fort Benjamine Harrison, Indiana, on July 12, 1919, and was discharged on September 19, 1919. File includes a survey, letter, and newspaper clippings.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Engineer Regiment, 25th
Topics: Myers, Harry Lee; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: Harold Edgar Neisler
Title: Harold Edgar Neisler file
Description: File documenting the participation of Harold Edgar Neisler in World War I. Neisler enlisted on June 28, 1918, and was first stationed at Camp Beauregard, Louisiana, with the 155th Infantry. He was sent overseas on August 21, 1918, and participated in the Battle of St. Mihiel and the Meuse-Argonne Offensive. He joined the 356th Infantry on September 24, 1918. After the armistice was signed, he was stationed in Schweich, Germany, and was hospitalized for the flu in January 1919. Neisler returned to the States on May 27, 1919, and was discharged on June 10, 1919. File includes a survey and postcard with his photo.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Infantry Regiment, 155th; United States. Army. Infantry Regiment, 356th
Topics: Neisler, Harold Edgar; Saint-Mihiel, Battle of, Saint-Mihiel, France, 1918; Argonne, Battle of the, France, 1918; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: John Newlin
Title: John Newlin file
Description: File documenting the participation of John Newlin in World War I. Newlin enlisted on July 5, 1917, and was first stationed at Fort Snelling, Michigan, with the 40th Infantry. He was transferred to Fort Sheridan, Illinois, in December 1917. In July 1918, he was sent to Camp Custer, Michigan. In September 1918, he joined the Medical Department of the 40th Infantry, and in December 1918, he transferred to Camp Sherman, Ohio. Newlin was discharged on August 1, 1919. File includes a survey.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Infantry Regiment, 40th; United States. Army. Medical Department
Topics: Newlin, John; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Title: Arthur Wilhelm Niedermeyer file
Description: File documenting the participation of Arthur Wilhelm Niedermeyer in World War I. Niedermeyer enlisted on December 15, 1917, and joined the aviation corps at Fort Sam Houston in Texas. Name: Philip Thomas O'Brien
Title: Philip Thomas O'Brien file
Description: File documenting the participation of Philip Thomas O'Brien in World War I. O'Brien enlisted on December 8, 1917, and served with the 210th Aero Squadron at the Chanute Field in Illinois. He was sent overseas on February 26, 1918, and was stationed at Doncaster in Yorkshire, England. He was hospitalized for influenza in Sheffield, England, and later at the Mossley Hill Camp in Liverpool, England, from August 27, 1918, to September 20, 1918. O'Brien was discharged on December 24, 1918. File includes a survey, postcard, newspaper clippings, and an RSVP card. Description supplemented by information from Fold3.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Air Service; United States. Army. Air Service. Aero Squadron, 210th
Topics: O'Brien, Philip Thomas; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students; Influenza Epidemic, 1918-1919
Genre/format: questionnaires; postcards; newspaper clippings; reply cards;

Name: William J. O'Hara
Title: William J. O'Hara file
Description: File documenting the participation of William J. O'Hara in World War I. O'Hara enlisted in July 1918 and was first stationed at Camp Wheeler, Georgia, for training. He was sent overseas on October 7, 1918, with the 122nd Infantry. He was transferred to the 144th Infantry shortly after arriving in France. He was stationed in Molosmes, France. He left France on May 24, 1919, and was discharged on June 13, 1919. File includes newspaper clippings and an RSVP card. Description supplemented by information from Fold3.

Name: Elizabeth Ellen O'Keefe
Title: Elizabeth Ellen O'Keefe file
Description: File documenting the participation of Elizabeth Ellen O'Keefe in World War I. O'Keefe entered the service on February 18, 1918, in the Army Nurse Corps in the Red Cross. She was first stationed at Camp Custer, Michigan, and was transferred to New York City to join Base Hospital no. 14. She was sent overseas on July 14, 1918, and was stationed at Mars-sur-Allier, France. She became the chief nurse at U.S. Convalescent Hospital no. 4 in Nice, France. O'Keefe returned to the States on July 31, 1919, and was discharged on August 31, 1918. Description supplemented by information from Fold3.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army Nurse Corps; American National Red Cross
Topics: O'Keefe, Elizabeth Ellen; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

She was sent overseas on July 14, 1918, and was stationed at Mars-sur-Allier, France. She became the chief nurse at U.S. Convalescent Hospital no. 4 in Nice, France. O'Keefe returned to the States on July 31, 1919, and was discharged on August 31, 1918. Description supplemented by information from Fold3.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army Nurse Corps; American National Red Cross
Topics: O'Keefe, Elizabeth Ellen; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: Walter Edward Opper
Title: Walter Edward Opper file
Description: File documenting the participation of Walter Edward Opper in World War I. Opper enlisted on August 4, 1918, and was first stationed at Brooks Field, Texas, with the 333rd Aero Squadron. He transferred to the 29th Aero Squadron at Godman Field in Kentucky, on September 25, 1918. Opper was discharged on May 25, 1919. File includes a survey.

Name: Lloyd Elmo Orendorff
Title: Lloyd Elmo Orendorff file
Description: File documenting the participation of Lloyd Elmo Orendorff in World War I. Orendorff was drafted on September 6, 1917, and first served at Camp Dodge, Iowa, with the 313th Engineers. He joined the officer's training school on May 15, 1918, and later the 163rd Depot Brigade on August 26, 1918. Orendorff was discharged on May 3, 1919. File includes a survey, photo, newspaper clipping, and an RSVP card.

Name: Joseph G. Outram
Title: Joseph G. Outram file
Description: File documenting the participation of Joseph G. Outram in World War I. Outram trained at Camp Dodge, Iowa, with the 339th Field Artillery. Name: Harry James Owens
Title: Harry James Owens file
Description: File documenting the participation of Harry James Owen in World War I. Owens enlisted on October 11, 1917, and first served at Kelly Field, Texas, with the 24th Aero Squadron. He was sent overseas with the 1st Observation Group on January 9, 1918. He was hospitalized in Folkstone, England, for rheumatic fever on February 10, 1918. He was stationed in Vavincourt, France, and participated in the Battle of St. Mihiel and the Meuse-Argonne Offensive. He joined the student detachment of Dijon University in Cote d'or, France, on March 1, 1919, and returned to the states on July 9, 1919. File includes a survey, signature card, postcards, envelopes, letters, newspaper clippings, and an RSVP card. Description supplemented by information from Fold3.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Air Service; United States. Army. Air Service. Aero Squadron, 24th; Université de Dijon
Topics: Owens, Harry J. (Harry James), 1894-; Saint-Mihiel, Battle of, Saint-Mihiel, France, 1918; Argonne, Battle of the, France, 1918; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students
Genre/format: questionnaires; cards (information artifacts); postcards; envelopes; letters (correspondence); newspaper clippings; reply cards;

Name: Lawrence Truman Oxley
Title: Lawrence Truman Oxley file
Description: File documenting the participation of Lawrence Truman Oxley in World War I. Oxley enlisted on June 28, 1918, and trained at Camp Taylor, Kentucky, with the 159th Depot Brigade. He was transferred to Camp Beauregard, Louisiana, on July 22, 1918, and joined the 114th Military Police battalion. Oxley was sent overseas on August 21, 1918. He was stationed in Chaumont, France, with the 2nd General Headquarters Military Police in December 1918. From February 22, 1919, to March 15, 1919, he was hospitalized for influenza in Chaumont at Base Hospital #90. In April 1919, he began teaching at the American Expeditionary Forces University in Beaune, France. Oxley returned to the States on June 10, 1919, and was discharged on July 7, 1919. File includes a survey, address cards, letters, and newspaper clippings. Description supplemented by information from Fold3.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Depot Brigade, 159th; United States. Army. Military Police Battalion, 114; American Expeditionary Forces University (Beaune, France)
Topics: Oxley, Lawrence Truman; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students
Genre/format: questionnaires; reply cards; letters (correspondence); newspaper clippings;

Name: Carroll Dwight Packard
Title: Carroll Dwight Packard file
Description: File documenting the participation of Carroll Dwight Packard in World War I. Packard enlisted on September 19, 1917, and first served at Camp Dodge, Iowa, for training. He transferred to Camp Pike, Arkansas, on November 22, 1917, and joined the 346th Infantry. He transferred to Camp Dix, New Jersey, on June 12, 1918, and was sent overseas on August 26, 1918. He was stationed in St. Nazaire, France on September 14, 1918, and returned home on June 3, 1919, after touring with a singing troupe in France, Belgium, and Germany after the armistice was signed. File includes a photo, letters, and newspaper clippings. Description supplemented by information from Fold3.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Infantry Regiment, 346th
Topics: Packard, Carroll Dwight; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Title: Edgar S. Packard file
Description: File documenting the participation of Edgar S. Packard in World War I. Packard enlisted on January 13, 1919. File includes a survey, photo, and newspaper clippings, some of which describe the experiences of Packard's son, Carroll Dwight Packard, during his service and touring singing group.

Name: George Merit Palmer
Title: George Merit Palmer file
Description: File documenting the participation of George Merit Palmer in World War I. Palmer was a lecturer for the Y.M.C.A. and travelled to camps in France, England, Scotland, and Ireland. He left New York and arrived in Bordeaux, France in January 1918, and returned from Liverpool, England, in December 1918. File includes a survey, photos, letters, newspaper clippings, a flier for his lectures, and two lectures.
Related organization/service branch: YMCA of the USA
Topics: Palmer, George Merit; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students
Genre/format: questionnaires; photographs; letters (correspondence); newspaper clippings; flier (printed matter); lectures

Name: Glenn Patton
Title: Glenn Patton file
Description: File documenting the participation of Glenn Patton in World War I. Patton enlisted in the summer of 1917 and served in the aviation section of the Navy. He was sent to France in October 1917, and was stationed in Paris in February 1918. He was also stationed at the U.S. Naval Air Stations in Moutchic and Pauillac, France. He was sent back to New York in August 1918 and was hospitalized for pneumonia before being sent home. He went back to the service in September 1918 and was stationed at the Brooklyn Navy Yard until his discharge on November 14, 1918. File includes newspaper clippings.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Navy; United States. Naval Aviation Corps; New York Naval Shipyard
Topics: Patton, Glenn; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: Paul Reed Peak
Title: Paul Reed Peak file
Description: File documenting the participation of Paul Reed Peak in World War I. Peak enlisted on May 24, 1917, and first joined the Engineers Enlisted Reserve Corps. On September 16, 1917, he joined the 26th Engineers and was sent to Camp Dix, New Jersey, for training. He joined the 23rd Engineers on October 8, 1917, and was stationed at Camp Meade, Maryland, Camp Laurel, Maryland, and Annapolis, Maryland, before being sent to Brest, France, on March 30, 1918. He returned to the States on June 11, 1919, and was discharged on July 3, 1919. File includes a survey, postcard, letters, and the September 13, 1918, issue of ΓÇ£The Highwayman,ΓÇ¥ a journal written by the 23rd Engineers.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Corps of Engineers. Regiment, 23rd
Topics: Peak, Paul Reed; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: Paul Reed Peak
Title: Paul Reed Peak file
Description: File documenting the participation of Paul Reed Peak in World War I. Peak enlisted on May 24, 1917, and first joined the Engineers Enlisted Reserve Corps. On September 16, 1917, he joined the 26th Engineers and was sent to Camp Dix, New Jersey, for training. He joined the 23rd Engineers on October 8, 1917, and was stationed at Camp Meade, Maryland, Camp Laurel, Maryland, and Annapolis, Maryland, before being sent to Brest, France, on March 30, 1918. He returned to the States on June 11, 1919, and was discharged on July 3, 1919. File includes a survey, postcard, letters, and the September 13, 1918, issue of ΓÇ£The Highwayman,ΓÇ¥ a journal written by the 23rd Engineers.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Corps of Engineers. Regiment, 23rd
Topics: Peak, Paul Reed; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: Arthur Frederick Peine
Title: Arthur Frederick Peine file
Description: File documenting the participation of Arthur Frederick Peine in World War I. Peine enlisted on May 18, 1917, and served at Fort Sheridan, Illinois, for officers training camp. He transferred to the infantry at Camp Grant, Illinois, on August 29, 1907. He joined the 161st Depot Brigade as an officer in March 1918. He joined the infantry transport personnel for trips from Newport News, Virginia, to Tours, France. Peine was discharged in July 1919. File includes a survey and newspaper clipping.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Infantry; United States. Army Transport Service
Topics: Peine, Arthur Frederick; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: Earl L. Pennington
Title: Earl L. Pennington file
Description: File documenting the participation of Earl L. Pennington in World War I. Pennington was drafted in early 1918 and was stationed at Camp Fremont, California, in the machine gun company of the 12th Infantry. He was discharged in February 1919. File includes a letter requesting his address and newspaper clippings.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Infantry Regiment, 12th (1861-1957)
Topics: Pennington, Earl L.; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: Clara Maude Penstone
Title: Clara Maude Penstone file
Description: File documenting the participation of Clara Maude Penstone in World War I. Penstone worked in the welfare branch of the Y.M.C.A. as a canteen worker at the camp in Brest, France. She left for France in January 1919 and returned on July 30, 1919. File includes her service record card, a photo, and newspaper clippings. Description supplemented by information from Fold3.
Related organization/service branch: YMCA of the USA
Topics: Penstone, Clara Maude; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students; Illinois State Normal University--Faculty

Name: Abram B. Perry
Location: Great Lakes Naval Training Center (Great Lakes, Ill.)
Title: Abram B. Perry file
Description: File documenting the participation of Abram B. Perry in World War I. Perry enlisted on May 10, 1917, and was first stationed in the Navy at the Great Lakes Naval Training Center in Illinois. He transferred to the 5th Marines in October 1917 in Quantico, Virginia, and was sent overseas, participating in a few of the major battles. He left Brest, France, on March 16, 1919, and was discharged on June 24, 1919. File includes letters and newspaper clippings. Description supplemented by information from Fold3.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Navy; United States. Marine Corps; United States. Marine Corps. Marine Regiment, 5th
Topics: Perry, Abram B.; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students; Bloomington High School (Bloomington, Ill.)

Name: Elbert Lawrence Perry
Title: Elbert Lawrence Perry file
Description: File documenting the participation of Elbert Lawrence Perry in World War I. Perry enlisted on June 1, 1917, in the Marine Corps and trained at Parris Island, South Carolina with the 60th Marines. He transferred to the 84th Marines in Quantico, Virginia, on September 19, 1917. He left for France on October 31, 1917. He spent 60 days in the Verdun Sector, and participated in the battles at Chateau-Thierry, Belleau Woods, and the Second battle of Soissons. He was hospitalized for a gunshot wound on July 19, 1918, at Base Hospital no. 27. He joined the 6th Marines Guard Company at Blois and Brest in France. He returned to the States on January 6, 1919, and was stationed at Quantico, Virginia, with the 14th Marines. On June 9, 1919, he was transferred to Milwaukee, Wisconsin, for recruiting duty. He was transferred to Denver, Colorado, on August 1, 1919, for recruiting. File includes a survey, signature card, photos, a postcard, letters, RSVP card, newspaper clippings, and a booklet documenting the 6th Marine Regiment's involvement in the Battles of Chateau-Thierry and Belleau Woods.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Marine Corps; Parris Island (S.C. : Recruit depot); United States. Marine Corps. Marine Regiment, 60th; United States. Marine Corps. Marine Regiment, 84th; United States. Marine Corps. Marine Regiment, 6th; United States. Marine Corps. Marine Regiment, 14th

Genre/format: questionnaires; cards (information artifacts); photographs; postcards; letters (correspondence); reply cards; newspaper clippings; booklets;

Name: Frances Elizabeth Peters
Title: Frances Elizabeth Peters file
Description: File includes the World War I service record card of Frances Elizabeth Peters. Peters entered the Navy Reserves on September 5, 1918, and served as a yeoman in Washington, D.C. She was discharged on July 31, 1919. Additional materials on Frances Elizabeth Peters can be found in this collection in the Frances Peters Kendrick file (Peters' married name).
Related organization/service branch: United States. Navy; United States. Naval Reserve
Topics: Peters, Frances Elizabeth; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: Maurice James Peters
Title: Maurice James Peters file
Description: File documenting the participation of Maurice James Peters in World War I. Peters enlisted in the Medical Corps on December 28, 1917. He was first stationed at Camp Greenleaf, Georgia. On April 1, 1918, he was transferred to Hampton, Virginia, and on April 30, 1918, he was sent to Souther Aviation Field in Georgia. Peters died on May 20, 1919, from a swimming accident. File includes a photo, letter, newspaper clipping, and a card with Peter's name with a gold star (used to denote the files of individuals who died in the line of duty).
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Medical Corps
Topics: Peters, Maurice James; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students
Genre/format: photographs; letters (correspondence); cards (information artifacts); newspaper clippings;

Name: DeWitt Talmage Petty
Title: DeWitt Talmage Petty file
Description: File documenting the participation of DeWitt Talmage Petty in World War I. Petty enlisted on August 27, 1917. Petty was stationed at Fort Sheridan, Illinois, before he was sent overseas on January 8, 1918, with the 38th Infantry. He participated in the battle of Chateau-Thierry and the Second Battle of the Marne. He was hospitalized in Paris for a gunshot wound from July 16, 1918, to October 30, 1918. In March 1919, he began teaching at the American Expeditionary University in Beaune, France, until his discharge on July 29, 1919. File includes a survey, letters, newspaper clippings, and his wedding announcement.

Name: DeWitt Talmage Petty
Title: DeWitt Talmage Petty file
Description: File documenting the participation of DeWitt Talmage Petty in World War I. Petty enlisted on August 27, 1917. Petty was stationed at Fort Sheridan, Illinois, before he was sent overseas on January 8, 1918, with the 38th Infantry. He participated in the battle of Chateau-Thierry and the Second Battle of the Marne. He was hospitalized in Paris for a gunshot wound from July 16, 1918, to October 30, 1918. In March 1919, he began teaching at the American Expeditionary University in Beaune, France, until his discharge on July 29, 1919. File includes a survey, letters, newspaper clippings, and his wedding announcement.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Infantry Regiment, 38th (1917-1957); American Expeditionary Forces University (Beaune, France)

Name: George Carl Phipps
Title: George Carl Phipps file
Description: File documenting the participation of George Carl Phipps in World War I. Phipps enlisted on June 14, 1918, and attended the Army School of Mechanics at Bradley University in Peoria, Illinois. He joined the Signal Corps on August 8, 1918, in Fort Leavenworth, Kansas, and later transferred to Camp Meade in Maryland. Phipps was discharged on January 19, 1919. File includes a survey, photo, and two letters.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; Bradley Polytechnic Institute (Peoria, Ill.); United States. Army. Signal Corps
Topics: Phipps, George Carl; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: George W. Piper
Title: George W. Piper file
Description: File documenting the participation of George W. Piper in World war I. Piper enlisted in July 1917 and served overseas with the 51st Field Artillery. He participated in the Second Battle of the Marne, the Battle of St. Mihiel, and the Meuse-Argonne Offensive. After the armistice was signed, Piper was stationed in Germany. File includes a survey.

Name: George Henry Primmer
Location: Great Lakes Naval Training Center (Great Lakes, Ill.)
Title: George Henry Primmer file
Description: File documenting the participation of George Henry Primmer in World War I. Primmer enlisted on July 10, 1918, and first served at the Great Lakes Naval Training Center in Illinois as a machinist's mate in the aviation service. He joined the Quartermaster Corps as an instructor at the Aviation School in October 1918. On January 5, 1919, he was sent to Columbia University, New York, on text writing detail for the Naval Aviation School. Primmer was discharged on March 4, 1919. File includes a survey and letter.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Navy; United States. Naval Aviation Corps; United States. War Dept. Quartermaster Corps; Columbia University
Topics: Primmer, George Henry; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: Edward P. Prince
Title: Edward P. Prince file
Description: File documenting the participation of Edward P. Prince in World War I. Prince enlisted on June 13, 1917, and was first stationed in Webster City, Iowa, with the 2nd Iowa Infantry. He transferred to Camp Cody, New Mexico, on October 1, 1917, to join the 109th Train Headquarters. He was sent overseas on October 12, 1918, first stationed at Romsey, England, and later Southhampton, England. He was sent to Cherbourg, France, and later Coulon, France. Prince was sent back to the States on July 7, 1919, and discharged on July 28, 1919. File includes a survey, photo, postcard, letters, and newspaper clippings.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Iowa Infantry Regiment, 2nd; United States. Army. Train Headquarters, 109th
Topics: Prince, Edward P.; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students
Genre/format: questionnaires; photographs; postcards; letters (correspondence); newspaper clippings;

Name: Madison J. Pulliam
Title: Madison J. Pulliam file
Description: File documenting the participation of Madison J. Pulliam in World War I. Pulliam enlisted in September 1918 in the Medical Corps. He was first stationed at Fort Riley, Kansas, for medical officers training school, and was transferred to Camp Wadsworth, South Carolina, on April 8, 1918, to join their base hospital. On August 31, 1918, he joined Base Hospital no. 63. He was sent to France on August 31, 1918, and joined Base Hospital no. 202 on October 24, 1918. On March 26, 1919, he joined Evacuation Hospital no. 26. According to the US Army Medical Department, Base Hospital no. 202 was stationed in Orleans, France, and Evacuation Hospital no. 26 was stationed in Neuenahr, Germany. Pulliam was sent back to the States on August 20, 1919, and discharged September 26, 1919. File includes a survey and newspaper clippings. Description supplemented by information from Fold3.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Medical Corps; United States. Army. Base Hospital No. 63; United States. Army. Base Hospital No. 202; United States. Army. Evacuation Hospital, 26th
Topics: Pulliam, Madison J.; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: Roscoe Pulliam
Title: Roscoe Pulliam file
Description: File documenting the participation of Roscoe Pulliam in World War I. Pulliam was drafted on October 7, 1917, and was first stationed at Camp Taylor, Kentucky, with the 333rd Infantry. He was sent overseas on January 13, 1918. He joined the 163rd Infantry and was stationed in St. Aignan, France. On February 28, he transferred to the 168th Infantry. He participated in the battles of Chateau-Thierry, St. Mihiel, and Lorraine, as well as the Meuse-Argonne Offensive. He was hospitalized for gas burns June 14, 1918, to July 16, 1918. He was stationed in France, Germany, Belgium, and Luxembourg until May 13, 1919, when he joined the American Expeditionary Forces University in Beaune, France. Pulliam left for the States on April 18, 1919, and was discharged on May 13, 1919. File includes a survey. Description supplemented by information from Fold3.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Infantry Regiment, 333rd; United States. Army. Infantry Regiment, 163rd; United States. Army. Infantry Regiment, 168th; American Expeditionary Forces University (Beaune, France)

Name: Ruthford Keith Purl
Location: Great Lakes Naval Training Center (Great Lakes, Ill.)
Title: Ruthford Keith Purl file
Description: File documenting the participation of Ruthford Keith Purl in World War I. Purl enlisted on June 10, 1918, in the naval reserves and was stationed at the Great Lakes Naval Training Center in Illinois. He transferred to Pelham Bay, New York, on November 20, 1918. On December 21, 1918, he transferred to New London, Connecticut. Purl was discharged on January 30, 1919. File includes a survey, photo, newspaper clippings, and an RSVP card.

Name: Chester Allen Quick
Title: Chester Allen Quick file
Description: File documenting the participation of Chester Allen Quick in World War I. Quick enlisted on May 25, 1918, and was first stationed at Camp Gordon, Georgia. He was sent overseas on August 28, 1918. He joined the 41st Infantry in October and November 1918 to participate in the last days of the Meuse-Argonne Offensive. He was transferred to the 62nd Prisoner of War Escort in December 1918. Quick was sent home on September 23, 1919, and was discharged on October 6, 1919. File includes a survey.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Infantry Regiment, 41st; United States. Army. Prisoner of War Escort, 62nd
Topics: Quick, Chester Allen; Argonne, Battle of the, France, 1918; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: William Eston Quick
Title: William Eston Quick file
Description: File documenting the participation of William Eston Quick in World War I. Quick enlisted on May 27, 1918, and was first stationed at Camp Gordon, Georgia, with the 6th Replacement Regiment. He was promoted to sergeant of the 1st Replacement on August 1, 1918, and began instructing soldiers in gas and bayonet defense. He was hospitalized in October 1918 for influenza. Quick was discharged on January 2, 1919. File includes a survey, photos, letters, and newspaper clippings.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Replacement Regiment, 6th; United States. Army. Replacement Regiment, 1st
Topics: Quick, William Eston; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: Frederick Stanilas Rabe
Title: Frederick Stanilas Rabe file
Description: File documenting the participation of Frederick Stanilas Rabe in World War I. Rabe enlisted on May 25, 1918, and was stationed at Camp Shelby, Mississippi, with the 149th Infantry Machine Gun Co. He was sent overseas on October 2, 1918, and was hospitalized in Portsmouth, England, with influenza upon arrival. After the armistice was signed, he was stationed in Winchester, England, and later in St. Aignan, France. He was hospitalized again on February 20, 1919. Rabe returned to the States on March 25, 1919, and was discharged April 9, 1919. File includes a survey and newspaper clippings, including one about John O. Morrissey signing a petition protesting the slow pace of soldiers being discharged and sent home.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Infantry Regiment, 149th
Topics: Rabe, Frederick Stanilas; Influenza Epidemic, 1918-1919; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: Dwight M. Ramsey
Title: Dwight M. Ramsey file
Description: File documenting the participation of Dwight M. Ramsey in World War I. Ramsey enlisted on March 29, 1918, in the Coast Artillery Corps. He was stationed in Fort Washington, Maryland, from April 1 to July 3, 1918. He transferred to Fort Monroe, Virginia, until September 25, 1918. He was then sent to Fort Worden, Washington, on October 10, 1918, until his discharge on December 10, 1918. He was counsel for four court martial trials and company commander of the 5th Coast Artillery Corps. File includes a photo, letters, newspaper clippings, an RSVP card, and Ramsey's wedding announcement.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Coast Artillery Regiment, 5th
Topics: Ramsey, Dwight M.; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students
Genre/format: photographs; letters (correspondence); newspaper clippings; reply cards; wedding announcements;

Name: Roy Arthur Ramseyer
Title: Roy Arthur Ramseyer file
Description: File documenting the participation of Roy Arthur Ramseyer in World War I. Ramseyer enlisted on May 16, 1918, and was first stationed at Camp Hancock, Georgia, with the Ordnance Supply School. He became a corporal and sergeant of the Ordnance Supply School on August 19, 1918. He transferred to the 5th Provisional Ordnance Battalion on October 12, 1918, in Mays Landing, New Jersey. On December 20, 1919, he joined the Military Guard. Ramseyer was discharged on January 20, 1919. File includes a survey, photo, postcard, letter, newspaper clippings, and an RSVP card.

Name: Roland Spencer Read
Title: Roland Spencer Read file
Description: File documenting the participation of Roland Spencer Read in World War I. Read did not meet the physical requirements for the U.S. draft and enlisted in the French army because their requirements were not as strict. He joined the service in September 1918 in the Ambulance and Lantern Service. He was stationed at Neuchateau, France, with the French Red Cross, and at Rheine, Germany. He was gassed at Rheine in March 1918 and discharged in July 1918. File includes a survey, letter, and newspaper clippings.
Related organization/service branch: France. Armée; Croix-Rouge française
Topics: Read, Roland Spencer; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Related organization/service branch: United States. Navy; United States. Naval Radio Service
Topics: Rebbe, Alfred Fred Henry; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: Glenn Scott Reddick
Title: Glenn Scott Reddick file
Description: File documenting the participation of Glenn Scott Reddick in World War I. Reddick enlisted on May 7, 1917, and was first stationed at Fort Adams, Rhode Island, with the 2nd Coast Artillery Corps. He was sent to France in March 1918. He joined the 52nd Coast Artillery Corps in April 1918 and was stationed in the Alsace Front near La Chappelle, France. In December 1918, he joined the 42nd Coast Artillery Corps and returned to the States on February 4, 1919. Reddick was discharged in March 1919. File includes a survey, a postcard with Reddick's photo, letters, and newspaper clippings. Description supplemented by information from Fold3.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; Camp Glenn (N.C.); United States. Army. Coast Artillery Regiment, 2nd; United States. Army. Coast Artillery Regiment, 52nd; United States. Army. Coast Artillery Regiment, 42nd

Name: William E. Reeser
Title: William E. Reeser file
Description: File documenting the participation of William E. Reeser in World War I. Reeser enlisted on April 28, 1918, and was stationed at Camp Travis, Texas, with the 358th Infantry. He was sent to France on June 9, 1918. He joined the 315th Supply Train on August 31, 1918. He participated in the battle of St. Mihiel and the Meuse-Argonne Offensive, and was stationed at Bernkastel, Germany, after the armistice was signed. Reeser returned to the States on June 9, 1919, and was discharged on June 17, 1919. File includes a survey, RSVP card, letter, and newspaper clippings.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Infantry Regiment, 358th; United States. Army. Supply Train, 315th
Topics: Reeser, William E.; Saint-Mihiel, Battle of, Saint-Mihiel, France, 1918; Argonne, Battle of the, France, 1918; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: Douglas Clay Ridgeley
Title: Douglas Clay Ridgeley file
Description: File documenting the participation of Douglas Clay Ridgeley in World War I. Ridgeley enlisted on December 19, 1918, in the Y.M.C.A. Army Education Commission. He was sent overseas on January 4, 1919, and travelled around to different army schools in France before taking part in organizing the American Expeditionary Forces University in Beaune, France. He was the Director of Geography, but also created classes for geology and agriculture. He also went on a lecture series through Germany, and was stationed at Coblenz, German, in May 1919. Ridgeley was discharged on June 10, 1919, in Beaune, and travelled around France and Germany on leave until he left for the States on July 6, 1919. File includes a survey, photo of Ridgeley, postcard, letters to Ridgeley, letters Ridgeley wrote to his daughter others, conference programs, newspaper clippings, and flier for a sight-seeing tour of Washington D.C.
Related organization/service branch: YMCA Army Educational Commission; American Expeditionary Forces University (Beaune, France)
Topics: Ridgeley, Douglas Clay; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students
Genre/format: questionnaires; photographs; postcards; letters (correspondence); programs (documents); newspaper clippings; flier (printed matter);

Name: Bert LaVan Riseling
Title: Bert LaVan Riseling file
Description: File documenting the participation of Bert LaVan Riseling in World War I. Riseling enlisted on June 28, 1917, and was first stationed at Kelly Field in Texas with the 54th Aero Squadron. He left for France on October 13, 1917, and was stationed at the airfields in Issoudun, France. He was hospitalized in Issoudun for pneumonia in December 1917 and January 1918. Riseling returned to the States on April 4, 1919, and was discharged on April 17, 1919. File includes a survey, newspaper clipping, and an RSVP card.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Air Service; United States. Army. Air Service. Aero Squadron, 54th

Title: Cecil W. Riseling file
Description: File documenting the participation of Cecil W. Riseling in World War I. He was stationed at Lincoln and Shrewsbury in England and later in Colombey-les-Belles, Amanty, and Beaune in France. He left France on June 11, 1919, and was discharged on July 11, 1919. Name: Frank Albert Robinson
Title: Frank Albert Robinson file
Description: File documenting the participation of Frank Albert Robinson in World War I. Robinson enlisted on May 8, 1918, and was first stationed at Camp Dix, New Jersey, with the 309th Field Artillery Battalion. He was sent to France on May 28, 1918, and quickly went to the front. He joined his unit band on August 13th, 1918, while stationed at Camp de Meucon in Brittany, France. He participated in battles in the Toul sector, the Battle of St. Mihiel, the Meuse-Argonne Offensive, and the Grandpre attack. On December 1, 1918, he was promoted to corporal of the band and stationed in Verdun, France. Robinson left for the States on April 26, 1919, and was discharged on May 22, 1919. File includes a survey, letters, and flier from his band's performance in El Paso, Texas. Description supplemented by information from Fold3.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Field Artillery Battalion, 309th
Topics: Robinson, Frank Albert; Bands (Music); Saint-Mihiel, Battle of, Saint-Mihiel, France, 1918; Argonne, Battle of the, France, 1918; Grandpre, Battle of the, France, 1918; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: Frank Albert Robinson
Title: Frank Albert Robinson file
Description: File documenting the participation of Frank Albert Robinson in World War I. Robinson enlisted on May 8, 1918, and was first stationed at Camp Dix, New Jersey, with the 309th Field Artillery Battalion. He was sent to France on May 28, 1918, and quickly went to the front. He joined his unit band on August 13th, 1918, while stationed at Camp de Meucon in Brittany, France. He participated in battles in the Toul sector, the Battle of St. Mihiel, the Meuse-Argonne Offensive, and the Grandpre attack. On December 1, 1918, he was promoted to corporal of the band and stationed in Verdun, France. Robinson left for the States on April 26, 1919, and was discharged on May 22, 1919. File includes a survey, letters, and flier from his band's performance in El Paso, Texas. Description supplemented by information from Fold3.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Field Artillery Battalion, 309th

Name: Richard T. Robinson
Title: Richard T. Robinson file
Description: File documenting the participation of Richard T. Robinson in World War I. Robinson enlisted on February 6, 1918, and was first stationed at Camp American University in Washington, D.C., with the 42nd Engineers. He left for France on May 10, 1918, and joined the 20th Engineers. He got in an accident on November 30, 1918, while constructing a railroad and stayed at Base Hosptial no. 6 in Bordeaux, France. He was sent home December 25, 1918, as a casual, and was sent to the Base Hospital at Camp Grant on January 27, 1919. Robinson was discharged on February 4, 1919. File includes photos, an RSVP card, a letter, and newspaper clippings.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Engineer Regiment, 42nd; United States. Army. Engineer Regiment, 20th
Topics: Robinson, Richard T.; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Title: John William Roche file
Description: File documenting the participation of John William Roche in World War I. Roche enlisted on June 1, 1918, and was first stationed at Camp Sheridan, Alabama, with the 46th Infantry. Name: Edward P. Roe
Title: Edward P. Roe file
Description: File includes a clipping of Edward P. Roe's service in World War I. Roe enlisted in late 1917 in the Ordnance Enlisted Reserve and was initially stationed at the Rock Island Arsenal in Illinois with plans to go to Kenosha, Wisconsin, for training. A letter in his sister Helen R. Roe's file describes his service in France with the Ordnance Department and his discharge date of March 14, 1919. He was also stationed in Camp Hancock, Georgia, before he went overseas.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Ordnance Department; Rock Island Arsenal (Ill.)
Topics: Roe, Edward P.; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Title: Helen R. Roe file
Description: File documenting the participation of Helen R. Roe in World War I. Title: James T. Rogers file

Name: William Elias Rolley
Title: William Elias Rolley file
Description: File documenting the participation of William Elias Rolley in World War I. Rolley enlisted on April 6, 1918, and first served at Fort Terry, New York. He transferred to Fort Monroe, Virginia, to join the Officers' Training Corps on July 5, 1918, and returned to Fort Terry on September 25, 1918, as a lieutenant in the Coast Artillery Corps. He joined the Air Service Radio School at Columbia University in New York City on October 25, 1918. On November 16, 1918, he transferred to Camp Eustis, Virginia, to join the 30th Coast Artillery Corps. He was sent to Fort Rodman, Massachusetts, on January 25, 1919, and later to Camp Devens, Massachusetts, on April 18, 1919, to work in the insurance office. He was discharged from active duty on October 31, 1919, but stayed at Camp Devens to join the U.S. Army Vocational Training School until September 16, 1920. File includes survey, photo, RSVP card, letter, and newspaper clippings.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Coast Artillery; Columbia University; United States. Army. Coast Artillery Regiment, 30th
Topics: Rolley, William Elias; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students
Genre/format: questionnaires; photographs; reply cards; letters (correspondence); newspaper clippings;

Name: Harold Ernest Ross
Title: Harold Ernest Ross file
Description: File documenting the participation of Harold Ernest Ross in World War I. Ross served in the Army and was stationed at Angel Island in California in November 1918. In 1917, Angel Island served as a detention center for German prisoners of war, and, in 1918, it served as a debarkation and discharge point for American soldiers, according to the California Department of Parks and Recreation. Ross was discharged in November 1918.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army
Topics: Ross, Harold Ernest; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: Nellie Ross
Title: Nellie Ross file
Description: File includes a service record card for Nellie Ross's participation in World War I. Ross volunteered for the Red Cross in the Army Nurse Corps with Base Hospital no. 13. She was sent to France on May 22, 1918, and was stationed in Limoges, France, according to the Army Medical Department. She returned to the States on March 6, 1919. Description supplemented by information from Fold3.
Related organization/service branch: American National Red Cross; United States. Army Nurse Corps
Topics: Ross, Nellie; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: William Rowley
Title: William Rowley file
Description: File documenting the participation of William Rowley in World War I. Rowley left for the army on November 26, 1917. He trained for the air service in Dallas, Texas, then joined the School of Military Aeronautics at the University of Texas in Austin, and then was sent to Barron Field in Fort Worth, Texas, upon graduation in May 1918. He joined the 84th Aero Squadron and transferred to Fort Sheridan, Alabama, and back to Fort Worth in January 1919. In February 1919, he was sent to Waco, Texas, where he was discharged within the month. Files include newspaper clippings.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Air Service; United States. Army. Air Service. Aero Squadron, 84th
Topics: Rowley, William; World War, 1914-1918; University High School (Normal, Ill.)--Students; Bloomington High School (Bloomington, Ill.)--Students

Name: Louis Ernest Rust
Title: Louis Ernest Rust file
Description: File documenting the participation of Louis Ernest Rust in World War I. Rust enlisted on December 14, 1917, and was first stationed at Chanute Field in Rantoul, Illinois, with the 210th Aero Squadron. He was sent overseas on February 26, 1918, and was stationed in Doncaster, England, on March 19, 1918. He was transferred on August 1, 1918, to Gormanston, Ireland. Rust returned to the States on December 4, 1918, and was discharged on December 24, 1918. File includes a survey, photo, postcard, letters, newspaper clippings, and an RSVP card.

Name: Percy Jackson Rutherford
Title: Percy Jackson Rutherford file
Description: File documenting the participation of Percy Jackson Rutherford in World War I. Rutherford enlisted on December 15, 1917, in the Marines. He trained at Parris Island, South Carolina, with the 5th Marines before he was sent overseas. He was hospitalized June 14, 1918, at Dijon, France, and on November 8, 1918, in Mesves-sur-Loire, France, for influenza. Rutherford returned to the States on August 3, 1919. File includes a survey and photo. Description supplemented by information from Fold3.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Marine Corps; United States. Marine Corps. Marine Regiment, 5th
Topics: Rutherford, Percy Jackson; Influenza Epidemic, 1918-1919; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: Robert Stillson Sanford
Title: Robert Stillson Sanford file
Description: File documenting the participation of Robert Stillson Sanford in World War I. Sanford enlisted on October 11, 1917, and was first stationed at Fort Worth, Texas, with the 183rd Aero Squadron. He was sent overseas on February 16, 1918, with the 139th Aero Squadron. He participated in the Battle of St. Mihiel and the Meuse-Argonne Offensive. From April 5 to August 15, 1918, he was hospitalized for pneumonia in Issoudon, France. Sanford returned to the States on March 24, 1919, and was discharged on April 9, 1919. File includes a survey, photos, letters, newspaper clippings, and an RSVP card.

Sanford returned to the States on March 24, 1919, and was discharged on April 9, 1919. File includes a survey, photos, letters, newspaper clippings, and an RSVP card.

Name: William McKinley Schaefer
Title: William McKinley Schaefer file
Description: File documenting the participation of William McKinley Schaefer in World War I. Schaefer enlisted on September 18, 1917, and first served at Camp Taylor, Kentucky, with the 333rd Infantry. He was sent to France on September 1, 1918, and was stationed in St. Astier, France. When the war ended, he was stationed in Bussy le Grand, France, with the 312th Infantry. Schaefer returned to the States on May 25th, 1919, and was discharged on June 3, 1919. File includes a survey and photo.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Infantry Regiment, 333rd; United States. Army. Infantry Regiment, 313rd

Name: Henry Frank Schneider
Title: Henry Frank Schneider file
Description: File documenting the participation of Henry Frank Schneider in World War I. Schneider enlisted on July 28, 1917, and first served at Columbus Barracks, Ohio, for training. He joined the Cooks and Bakers School at Fort Riley, Kansas on August 17, 1918. He transferred to Camp Dodge, Iowa, to join the Quartermaster Corps' Fort Riley Bakery Co. 331 on August 28, 1918. He was sent overseas on October 11, 1918, with the Bakery Co. 370. He was stationed at the Pontanezen Barracks in Brest, France, Gievres, France, and Le Mans, France. He joined Baker Co. 317 on June 25, 1919, and was stationed in St. Nazaire, France. He returned to the States on June 25, 1919, and was discharged July 15, 1919. File includes a survey, photo, and newspaper clipping.
Related organization/service branch: United States. War Dept. Quartermaster Corps
Topics: Schneider, Henry Frank; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: Roy Schofield
Title: Roy Schofield file
Description: File documenting the participation of Roy Schofield in World War I. Schofield enlisted on May 29, 1917, and was stationed at Fort Riley, Kansas, in the Medical Department. He joined Field Hospital no. 18 on July 25, 1917. On August 28, 1917, he joined Provisional Field Hospital no. 4 at Camp Lewis, Washington. He joined Field Hospital no. 361 on October 14, 1917, and was sent overseas on July 12, 1918. He participated in the Battle of St. Mihiel, the Meuse-Argonne Offensive, and the Battle of Lys. On October 25, 1918, he was stationed in Ypers, Belgium. Schofield returned to the States on April 20, 1919, and was discharged on May 7, 1919. File includes a survey, photos, letters, and newspaper clippings. Description supplemented by information from Fold3.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Medical Department; United States. Army. Field Hospital, 18th
Topics: Schofield, Roy; Saint-Mihiel, Battle of, Saint-Mihiel, France, 1918; Argonne, Battle of the, France, 1918; Lys, Battle of the, 1918; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: Walter Dill Scott
Title: Walter Dill Scott file
Description: File documenting the participation of Walter Dill Scott in World War I. Scott enlisted in November 1918 and was the Director of Committee in Classification of Personnel in the Army in Washington, D.C. He created an aptitude test for determining which privates should go into officers' training school. He was sent to France in November 1918, where he also created a way to organize the men and women for demobilization and return to the States. He was released from service in April 1919. File includes Scott's service record card, a letter, newspaper clippings, and an RSVP card.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army
Topics: Scott, Walter Dill, 1869-1955 ; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students
Genre/format: questionnaires; letters (correspondence); newspaper clippings; reply cards;

Name: Guy Wesley Sebright
Title: Guy Wesley Sebright file
Description: File documenting the participation of Guy Wesley Sebright in World War I. Sebright enlisted on September 17, 1917, and first served at Camp Pike, Arkansas, with the 346th Infantry. On January 5, 1918, he joined the Officers Training Corps and became a sergeant on April 19, 1918. He then transferred to Camp Lee, Virginia, on June 1, 1918, to join the Replacement Troops. On July 16, 1918, he was sent to Camp Custer, Michigan, to join the 78th Infantry. Sebright was discharged on February 18, 1919. File includes a survey, postcard, letter, and newspaper clipping.

Name: John B. Shaver
Title: John B. Shaver file
Description: File documenting the participation of John B. Shaver in World War I. Shaver enlisted in December 1917. He was sent overseas on March 14, 1918, with the 1st Battalion Ordnance Base Depot. He participated in the battles of Chateau-Thierry, St. Mihiel, and Verdun, and the Meuse-Argonne Offensive. He joined the 3rd Army Machine Gun and Small Arms Center while stationed in Coblenz, Germany, with the Army of Occupation. He also attended the American Expeditionary Forces University in Beaune, France, until he could return in the summer of 1919. Shaver was discharged in July 1919. File includes a survey and newspaper clipping. Description supplemented by information from Fold3.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Ordnance Department

Name: John B. Shaver
Title: John B. Shaver file
Description: File documenting the participation of John B. Shaver in World War I. Shaver enlisted in December 1917. He was sent overseas on March 14, 1918, with the 1st Battalion Ordnance Base Depot. He participated in the battles of Chateau-Thierry, St. Mihiel, and Verdun, and the Meuse-Argonne Offensive. He joined the 3rd Army Machine Gun and Small Arms Center while stationed in Coblenz, Germany, with the Army of Occupation. He also attended the American Expeditionary Forces University in Beaune, France, until he could return in the summer of 1919. Shaver was discharged in July 1919. File includes a survey and newspaper clipping. Description supplemented by information from Fold3.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Ordnance Department

Name: Eleanor Sheldon
Title: Eleanor Sheldon file
Description: File documenting the participation of Eleanor Sheldon in World War I. Sheldon enlisted in February 1919 and worked with the Y.M.C.A. She was sent overseas on April 12, 1919, and worked as a canteen worker at a camp in La Mans, France. Sheldon returned to the States on August 17, 1919, and was discharged within the month. File includes a survey, her service record card, postcards, and newspaper clippings.

Name: Ray C. Shibe
Title: Ray C. Shibe file
Description: File documenting the participation of Ray C. Shibe in World War I. Shibe entered the service in spring 1917. He was stationed at Camp Jackson, South Carolina in March 1918 in the Officers' Training School. Upon receiving his commission, he was sent to Camp Sevier, South Carolina, where he got married to a Normal woman. He was sent to Camp Pike, Arkansas, by mid-June 1918 to train soldiers in the 29th Infantry. Shibe was discharged in February 1919. File includes a letter and newspaper clippings.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Infantry Regiment, 29th (1901-1957)

Name: Henry Tilghman Shields
Title: Henry Tilghman Shields file
Description: File documenting the participation of Henry Tilghman Shields in World War I. Shields enlisted on December 11, 1916, and was stationed at Fort Omaha, Nebraska, for training. He was hospitalized for appendicitis in July 1917. After a few weeks' recovery, he transferred to Des Moines, Iowa, to join the aviation corps. Just days before he was supposed to leave for France in November 1917, he contracted spinal meningitis which caused temporary paralysis on his left side. He was sent back to Iowa to join the hydrogen department as an electrician, and later sent to Fort Monroe, Virginia, to join the balloon squadron in January 1918. He was hospitalized in February 1918 for meningitis, and then was sent to the U.S. General Hospital no. 6 at Fort McPherson, Georgia, for treatment. He went on medical furlough for a few months and was able to join the 677th Aero Squadron in November 1918 at Camp Morrison in Newport News, Virginia. Shields was discharged in February 1919. File includes a survey, photo, letters, newspaper clippings, and an RSVP card.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Air Service; United States. Army. Balloon Section; United States. Army. Air Service. Aero Squadron, 677th
Topics: Shields, Henry Tilghman; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students
Genre/format: questionnaires; photographs; letters (correspondence); newspaper clippings; reply cards;

Name: Bernard H. Shockel
Title: Bernard H. Shockel file
Description: File includes a survey documenting the participation of Bernard H. Shockel in World War I. Shockel enlisted on December 18, 1917, and first served in Chicago, Illinois, with the Meteorological Service Signal Corps. He transferred to St. Louis, Missouri, to join a detached depot company on January 4, 1918. On April 5, 1918, he transferred to Fort Wood, New York, and was sent overseas on June 12, 1918, with the Meteorological Section of the Signal Corps. He participated in the Battle of St. Mihiel and the Meuse-Argonne Offensive. Shockel returned to the States on February 27, 1919, and was discharged on March 27, 1919.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Sanitary Corps; United States. Army. Meteorological Service
Topics: Shockel, Bernard H.; Saint-Mihiel, Battle of, Saint-Mihiel, France, 1918; Argonne, Battle of the, France, 1918; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Faculty

Name: Dorr Miller Simer
Title: Dorr Miller Simer file
Description: File documenting the participation of Dorr Miller Simer in World War I. Simer enlisted on December 27, 1917, and was first stationed at Camp Dodge, Iowa, with the 349th Infantry. He transferred to Camp Gordon, Georgia, in April 1918, to join the 328th Infantry. He was sent overseas on May 1, 1918, and participated in the Battle of St. Mihiel and the Meuse-Argonne Offensive. He was hospitalized from September 15, 1918, to October 13, 1918, at Bast Hospital no. 28 in Contrexeville, France, for a head wound from shrapnel. Simer returned to the States on May 9, 1919, and was discharged on June 3, 1919. File includes a survey and letters. Description supplemented by information from Fold3.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Infantry Regiment, 349th; United States. Army. Infantry Regiment, 328th
Topics: Simer, Dorr Miller; Saint-Mihiel, Battle of, Saint-Mihiel, France, 1918; Argonne, Battle of the, France, 1918; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Title: Miles Gaylord Simons file
Description: File documenting the participation of Miles Gaylord Simons in World War I. Simons enlisted in August 1917, and was stationed at Camp Travis, Texas, with the Engineers Department. He transferred to Camp Sheridan, Alabama, in April 1918, and joined the 22nd Engineers. He was sent to France on June 20, 1918, and was stationed in Abainville, France, in December 1918. Simons returned to the States on July 4, 1919, and was discharged shortly after. File includes a postcard and newspaper clippings. Description supplemented by information from Fold3.

Name: Doy William Skinner
Title: Doy William Skinner file
Description: File documenting the participation of Doy William Skinner in World War I. Skinner enlisted on July 30, 1917, and was stationed in Pontiac, Illinois, with the 3rd Illinois Infantry, which later became the 129th Infantry. He transferred to Camp Logan, Texas on October 10, 1917. He was sent overseas on May 9, 1918, and participated in the Battle of Villiers-Bretonneux, on the Albert Front, the Meuse-Argonne Offensive, and at Dead Man's Hill in the Battle of Verdun. At Verdun, he was hit in the heart by shrapnel and died on October 17, 1918. His body was returned to the States on August 1, 1921. File includes a survey, photo, letters, newspaper clippings, and a card with Skinner's name with a gold star (used to denote the files of individuals who died in the line of duty). Description supplemented by information from Fold3.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Illinois Infantry Regiment, 3rd; United States. Army. Infantry Regiment, 129th
Topics: Skinner, Doy William; Villers-Bretonneux, 2nd battle of the, France, 1918; Argonne, Battle of the, France, 1918; Verdun, Battle of, Verdun, France, 1916; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: Alice Orme Smith
Title: Alice Orme Smith file
Description: File documents the participation of Alice Orme Smith in World War I. Smith entered the army on May 14, 1917, and served with the Presbyterian Base Hospital Unit no. 2. She was sent overseas on May 12, 1917, and was stationed in Etretat, France, with General Hospital no. 1. She transferred to Mobile Hospital no. 2 and was stationed at the Bussy-le-Chateau when the Germans attacked. Smith was discharged on February 11, 1919. File includes her service record card, a letter, and a newspaper clipping.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. General Hospital No. 1; United States. Army. Mobile Hospital No. 2
Topics: Smith, Alice Orme; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: C. Nolan Smith
Title: C. Nolan Smith file
Description: File documenting the participation of C. Nolan Smith in World War I. Smith enlisted on October 5, 1917, and served with the 130th Infantry at Camp Logan, Texas. He was sent to France on May 16, 1918. During the Meuse-Argonne Offensive, Smith was shot and died on November 10, 1918. His body returned to the States on August 2, 1921. File includes photos, letters from his sister, including one documenting their brother's, C. Stanley Smith's, experience in the war, and a card with a Smith's name with a gold star (used to denote the files of individuals who died in the line of duty). Description supplemented by information from Fold3.

Name: Carl Ross Smith
Location: Great Lakes Naval Training Center (Great Lakes, Ill.)
Title: Carl Ross Smith file
Description: File documenting the participation of Carl Ross Smith in World War I. Smith enlisted on June 21, 1918, and was first stationed at the Great Lakes Naval Training Center in Illinois. He transferred to Washington, D.C. on September 1, 1918, to join the Metallurgical Division as a chemist at the Naval Gun Factory. Smith was discharged on February 3, 1919. File includes a survey, photos, a postcard, letters, newspaper clippings, and an RSVP card.

Name: Carl Weems Smith
Title: Carl Weems Smith file
Description: File documenting the participation of Carl Weems Smith in World War I. Smith served with the 6th Marine Corps. He was a drill sergeant at the Marine Corps Recruit Depot on Parris Island, South Carolina, until he was sent overseas in July 1918. He participated in battles at the Toulon Sector, the Aisne Defensive, the Battle of Chateau Thierry, the Aisne Marne Offensive, at the Marbache Sector, the Battle of St. Mihiel, and at the Champagne Sector. He was wounded on October 8, 1918, while at the Champagne Sector. Smith returned to the States on July 25, 1919. File includes a survey, letter, newspaper clippings, and an RSVP card.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Marine Corps; United States. Marine Corps. Marine Regiment, 6th; Parris Island (S.C. : Recruit depot)

Name: Catherine Belle Smith
Title: Catherine Belle Smith file
Description: File documenting the participation of Catherine Belle Smith in World War I. Smith joined the Red Cross in August 1918 in the Army Nurse Corps. Title: Dudley Chase Smith file
Description: File documenting the participation of Dudley Chase Smith in World War I. Name: George Ernest Smith
Title: George Ernest Smith file
Description: File documenting the participation of George Ernest Smith in World War I. Smith enlisted on June 12, 1917, and first served with the Illinois National Guard. He joined the 122nd Machine Gun Battalion on October 11, 1917, and the 123rd Machine Gun Battalion on January 29, 1918. He was sent to France on May 16, 1918. He was stationed at the frontlines in the La Houssoye Sector, the Hangard Sector, the Albert Sector, during the Meuse-Argonne Offensive, at the Toyon Sector, and at Marcheville, France. After the war, he transferred to Beaune, France, to teach at the American Expeditionary Forces University. Smith was discharged on July 15, 1919. File includes a letter, newspaper clippings, and an RSVP card.
Related organization/service branch: Illinois. National Guard; United States. Army; United States. Army. Machine Gun Battalion, 122nd; United States. Army. Machine Gun Battalion, 123rd; American Expeditionary Forces University (Beaune, France)
Topics: Smith, George Ernest; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: George Ernest Smith
Title: George Ernest Smith file
Description: File documenting the participation of George Ernest Smith in World War I. Smith enlisted on June 12, 1917, and first served with the Illinois National Guard. He joined the 122nd Machine Gun Battalion on October 11, 1917, and the 123rd Machine Gun Battalion on January 29, 1918. He was sent to France on May 16, 1918. He was stationed at the frontlines in the La Houssoye Sector, the Hangard Sector, the Albert Sector, during the Meuse-Argonne Offensive, at the Toyon Sector, and at Marcheville, France. After the war, he transferred to Beaune, France, to teach at the American Expeditionary Forces University. Smith was discharged on July 15, 1919. File includes a letter, newspaper clippings, and an RSVP card.
Related organization/service branch: Illinois. National Guard; United States. Army; United States. Army. Machine Gun Battalion, 122nd; United States. Army. Machine Gun Battalion, 123rd; American Expeditionary Forces University (Beaune, France)
Topics: Smith, George Ernest; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: John Aaron Smith
Title: John Aaron Smith file
Description: File documenting the participation of John Aaron Smith in World War I. Smith enlisted on September 17, 1917, and trained at Camp Dodge, Iowa, with the 349th Infantry. He left for Brest, France on February 18, 1918, and joined the Meteorological Service. Smith returned to the States on January 15, 1919, and was discharged on January 25, 1919. File includes a survey, photo, and newspaper clippings.

Title: Louis Francis Smith file
Description: File documenting the participation of Louis Francis Smith in World War I. Name: Stanley Charles Smith
Title: Stanley Charles Smith file
Description: File documenting the participation of Stanley Charles Smith in World War I. Smith enlisted on August 3, 1917, and served in Houston, Texas, as a mechanic with the 130th Infantry. While overseas, he participated in the Meuse-Argonne Offensive, the Battle of the Somme, battles at the Verdun front in Bois de Chaume, France, and at Marcheville, France. He was hospitalized at Field Hospital no. 55 in Toul, France, on November 10, 1918, and again in December 1918 at Base Hospital no. 27 in Angers, France. Smith was discharged on May 27, 1919. File includes a survey, photo, and letter.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Infantry Regiment, 130th (1917-1959)
Topics: Smith, Stanley Charles; Argonne, Battle of the, France, 1918; Somme, 2nd Battle of the, France, 1918; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: Willard Carl Smith
Title: Willard Carl Smith file
Description: File documenting the participation of Willard Carl Smith in World War I. Smith served with the Sanitary Corps in the 26th Engineers at Allentown, Pennsylvania. He was in Washington, D.C., in September 1918, and was later sent overseas. On September 8, 1919, he left the army and joined the Red Cross to work in Public Health and Sanitation. He was stationed in Paris, France, in February 1920, and in March 1920, he traveled to Russia and the Baltic States (Estonia, Latvia, and Lithuania). File includes postcards, letters, and newspaper clippings.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Engineer Regiment, 26th; United States. Army. Sanitary Corps
Topics: Smith, Willard Carl; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: Robert Snyder
Title: Robert Snyder file
Description: File documenting the participation of Robert Snyder in World War I. Snyder volunteered for the army at Fort Washington, Maryland, and transferred to Fort Hunt, Virginia, in June 1918 to join the 35th Coast Artillery Corps. He was sent overseas on August 22, 1918. Snyder left Marsailles, France, on February 10, 1919. File includes a letter asking for his address and newspaper clippings. Description supplemented by information from Fold3.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Coast Artillery Regiment, 35th

Title: William Augustus South file
Description: File documenting the participation of William Augustus South in World War I. South enlisted on March 28, 1918, and served at Camp Dodge, Illinois, with the 137th Infantry. Name: John Elmer Stahlheber
Title: John Elmer Stahlheber file
Description: File documenting the participation of John Elmer Stahlheber in World War I. Stahlheber enlisted on April 29, 1918, and was first stationed at Camp Dix, New Jersey, with the 309th Machine Gun Battalion. He was sent overseas on May 27, 1918, and was stationed in Le Waast, France. He transferred to Herlincourt, France, on July 20, 1918, and was sent to different locations around France, before participating in the Battle of St. Mihiel and later the Meuse-Argonne Offensive. He stayed in Magny-la-Ville, France, from November 17, 1918, until April 27, 1919, when he was sent to Marsaille, France, to go back to the states. Stahlheber left France on May 10, 1919, and was discharged on June 10, 1919. File includes a survey.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Machine Gun Battalion, 309th
Topics: Stahlheber, John Elmer; Saint-Mihiel, Battle of, Saint-Mihiel, France, 1918; Argonne, Battle of the, France, 1918; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: John Elmer Stahlheber
Title: John Elmer Stahlheber file
Description: File documenting the participation of John Elmer Stahlheber in World War I. Stahlheber enlisted on April 29, 1918, and was first stationed at Camp Dix, New Jersey, with the 309th Machine Gun Battalion. He was sent overseas on May 27, 1918, and was stationed in Le Waast, France. He transferred to Herlincourt, France, on July 20, 1918, and was sent to different locations around France, before participating in the Battle of St. Mihiel and later the Meuse-Argonne Offensive. He stayed in Magny-la-Ville, France, from November 17, 1918, until April 27, 1919, when he was sent to Marsaille, France, to go back to the states. Stahlheber left France on May 10, 1919, and was discharged on June 10, 1919. File includes a survey.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Machine Gun Battalion, 309th
Topics: Stahlheber, John Elmer; Saint-Mihiel, Battle of, Saint-Mihiel, France, 1918; Argonne, Battle of the, France, 1918; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: James Grover Stanton
Title: James Grover Stanton file
Description: File documenting the participation of James Grover Stanton in World War I. Stanton enlisted on May 14, 1917, and trained at Fort Sheridan, Illinois, with the Infantry. He transferred to Camp Grant, Illinois on September 1, 1917. He became a 2nd Lieutenant of Infantry on June 1, 1918, and was sent to Camp Pike, Arkansas, on June 10, 1918, to command Casual Co. 63 and 83. On October 30, 1918, he transferred to Camp Polk, North Carolina, to join the Tank Corps. Stanton was discharged on February 7, 1919. File includes a letter.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Infantry; United States. Army. Tank Corps
Topics: Stanton, James Grover; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: James Raymond Stephenson
Title: James Raymond Stephenson file
Description: File documenting the participation of James Raymond Stephenson in World War I. Stephenson enlisted on August 10, 1917, and received training in the Army School of Military Aeronautics at the University of Illinois Urbana, Illinois. He transferred to Dallas, Texas, on January 10, 1918, and then to Fort Worth, Texas, on February 1, 1918. He transferred to Fairfield, Ohio, on July 15, 1918, and was sent to France on August 20, 1918, with the Air Service Military Aeronautics. He was stationed at the 3rd Aviation Instruction Center in Issoudun, France, on September 1, 1918. Stephenson returned to the States on February 21, 1919, and was discharged on February 25, 1919. File includes a survey, letter, and newspaper clippings.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign. School of Military Aeronautics; United States. Army. Air Service
Topics: Stephenson, James Raymond; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students; University High School (Normal, Ill.)--Students

Title: William H. Sterling file

Name: Bradford Alan Stewart
Title: Bradford Alan Stewart file
Description: File documenting the participation of Bradford Alan Stewart in World War I. Steward enlisted on April 12, 1918, and was stationed in Washington, D.C., with the 1st Replacement Engineers. In August 1918, he was sent to France and stationed in Angers, France, with the 116th Engineers. He joined the Camouflage Section of the 40th Engineers on September 10, 1918, at the American Expeditionary Forces Headquarters in Dijon and Nancy, France, where he specialized in designs to disguise roads, guns, and other items. He participated in the battles at the Verdun and Meuse fronts. Stewart returned to the States on January 24, 1919, and was discharged on February 14, 1919. File includes photos, postcard, letter, newspaper clippings, RSVP card, and a program for an event held at ISNU with a poem written by Stewart.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Corps of Engineers; United States. Army. Engineer Regiment, 116th; United States. Army. Engineer Regiment, 40th
Topics: Stewart, Bradford Alan; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students
Genre/format: photographs; postcards; letters (correspondence); newspaper clippings; reply cards; programs (documents);

Name: Harry Edward Stewart
Title: Harry Edward Stewart file
Description: File documenting the participation of Harry Edward Stewart in World War I. Stewart enlisted on September 2, 1917, and was first stationed at the Puget Sound Navy Yard in the Navy Reserve Force. He joined the Transport Service on July 15, 1918, and, on August 3, 1918, he became a supply officer on the U.S.S. Western Maid. They made stops in the United States, at Falmouth, Plymouth, and London in England, and in Rotterdam, and Hague in the Netherlands. Steward was discharged on May 9, 1919. File includes a survey, photos, postcards, letters, and newspaper clippings.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Navy; United States. Naval Reserve; United States. Navy. Supply Corps
Topics: Stewart, Harry Edward; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students
Genre/format: questionnaires; photographs; postcards; letters (correspondence); newspaper clippings;

Name: Samuel Clarence Stout
Title: Samuel Clarence Stout file
Description: File documenting the participation of Samuel Clarence Stout in World War I. Stout enlisted in June 1917 and was first stationed in Des Moines, Iowa, in the Medical Department. He joined the School of Military Aeronautics at the University of Illinois in Urbana, Illinois, in December 1917. Upon graduation, he was stationed at Kelly Field, Texas, in February 1918. In May 1918, he transferred to Brooks Field, Texas, to be a flight instructor, and in August 1918, he was sent to Souther Field, Georgia. Stout was discharged on March 29, 1918. File includes a survey, letter, and newspaper clippings.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Medical Department; United States. Army. Air Service
Topics: Stout, Samuel Clarence; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

In May 1918, he transferred to Brooks Field, Texas, to be a flight instructor, and in August 1918, he was sent to Souther Field, Georgia. Stout was discharged on March 29, 1918. File includes a survey, letter, and newspaper clippings.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Medical Department; United States. Army. Air Service
Topics: Stout, Samuel Clarence; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: Ellis Deloss Stubblefield
Title: Ellis Deloss Stubblefield file
Description: File documenting the participation of Ellis Deloss Stubblefield in World War I. Stubblefield enlisted on July 20, 1917, and was first stationed at Camp Custer, Michigan with the Quartermaster Corps. He joined the 344th Motor Truck Company on October 15, 1917, and later joined the Engineer Corps on the 457th Motor Truck Company on January 18, 1918, at Fort Myer, Virginia. He was sent overseas on May 10, 1918, and was stationed at Bordeaux, France, with the 695th Motor Transport Company. In November 1918, he was hospitalized for influenza. Stubblefield left for the States on July 8, 1919, and was discharged in July 1919. File includes surveys and newspaper clippings. Description supplemented by information from Fold3.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. War Dept. Quartermaster Corps; United States. Army. Motor Truck Company, 344th; United States. Army. Corps of Engineers; United States. Army. Motor Truck Company, 457th; United States. Army. Motor Truck Company, 695th
Topics: Stubblefield, Ellis Deloss; Influenza Epidemic, 1918-1919; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: Edmund White Sutherland
Title: Edmund White Sutherland file
Description: File documenting the participation of Edmund White Sutherland in World War I. Sutherland entered the service on September 5, 1918, at Camp Grant, Illinois. He died on October 7, 1918, from pneumonia caused by influenza. File includes a photo, a letter from his wife, newspaper clippings, and a card with Sutherland's name with a gold star (used to denote the files of individuals who died in the line of duty).
